reviews.review: History so Fascinating You May Forget the Archtecture. This is a must see! Aside from the beautiful architecture inside are the crypts and shores of the Royalty of England dating back 1000, yes 1000, years! Most of the Tutors are buried here as well as many literary and cultural icons. Chaucer, Jane Austen, Shakespeare, Lawrence Olivier and too many more to name. There is an informative free audio tour which you can pick up at the entry, but entry itself is not free (@$20 pp, depending on the exchange rate). Do not miss this if you are visiting London!
Sunday Service. Attended 11:15 service. Choir and organ were outstanding. Nice to attend a service where parts are sung in Latin. Abby itself is beautiful. Stained glass is lovely.

So much history in such a small space. The only bad thing about Westminster Abbey is that you can't take pictures to try and remember everything. The amount of history crammed into this church is mind-boggling. Of course I knew about the royal weddings but realizing that there is a thousand years worth of history in this beautiful building was mind-blowing! The audio tour was fun to listen to as you walked along and I learned so many facts and tidbits. It made me want to learn a lot more about royal history as well. There was actually a church service going on when we visited which was great to see as well.

Love the history but the staff are rude !. I've been here a few times and love the sense of history. Why they are sooo uptight about photos I'll never know. (without flash, not disturbing anyone). They have some ridiculous 'walk this way' tour that takes you thru the buildings and so everyone ends up in a crush if someone slows down. The staff then end up being the walk-this-way police, or the photo police, or the move along barkers. To make it worth your 20L go early and avoid some of the hastle.

Finally Got to See Inside. My third trip to London and the work inside was complete enough for me to get to see inside of the cathedral this trip. It is a beautiful place full of history and a good stopping place if you follow the Royals. To see where they are married and crowned in person is quiet the exerience

Beautiful and historic. London can be so overwhelming but the Abbey tour is a great place to focus on the Westminster complex. After arriving from our hotel by tube We caught changing of the Horse Guard at Whitehall 11am then strolled on over with our pre purchased tickets ($11 online) saved us time in the que and nice because they were good for anytime on that day. The interior is spectacular and huge but very manageable due to available helpful staff and very easy to follow audio guides (included with all tours) you use independently. We did not use the personal tours which you can join at specific times. Very cool, one of my favorite London experiences.
Such a Beautiful Experience!. We love Westminster Abbey and always take time for Evensong...such lovely music and a wonderful experience!
Full of history. First time visit I was amazed by the history of the place and details of all the historical people buried their. this is as remarkable as any building I have visited

Amazing. After visiitng the beautiful interiors and walking through the gift shop at the end, I noticed there wa san evening church service starting and joined it. Womderful atmosphere inside the Abbey. I visited in April 2007.

Do not miss this!. We had a guided tour through here and I cannot say enough about this place. So much history. They show you things that you never knew. You will be amazed to be standing where so much history has happened in that very spot. There are several famous people buried there as well. Lots of walking so wear comfy shoes
Absorb the History. Take the self-guided tour. Be sure to look up at the ceilings. And read tombstones on the floor; you may find an ancestor's name.
Posh. This is one of the top most area in London and all the great attraction lies nearby. Surely give a visit and get the feel of royalty.

Peaceful Beauty. Westminster Abbey was one of my favorite spots to visit in London. The self-guided tour complete with individual audio players can be done at your own pace. We spent hours learning, listening and enjoying the beauty of the Abbey and art and architecture within it's walls. It is a feast for your eyes, seeing the burial crypts of kings and queens, noblemen and holy men as well as artists, poets and scientists. I was humbled to stand in the same space where Kings and Queens worshiped, coronations were held, royal weddings performed and many were laid to rest. It is more magnificent than I ever imagined it to be.Surprising to me was Poet's Corner - where the artists are entombed or honored. Charles Dickens, Rudyard Kipling, and Sir Henry Irving to name a few. Sir Isaac Newton's Grave is huge and a work of art like many of the others. Charles Darwin also rests in the Abbey.The Coronation Chair, made for King Edward I, that is still used, also resides in the Abbey - be sure to see it before you leave.
Impressive. Impressive architecture and history behind the walls. Probably the best spent money. I would love to see it again aided by a guide who can explain and offer details.

Truly amazing. Don't miss a visit to Westminster Abbey, it is truly an amazing place. The attention to detail is absolutely mind blowing. When we visited the Abbey it was closed to general public viewing but there was a Eucarist service being conducted. Not knowing what to expect, we went in and it only added to the experience. Its a shame they don't allow photos as it was an experience to behold. It is easily accessible via the hop on hop off buss.

Awesome amount of history in one location.. Awesome architecture with an amazing history. So much has happened in the church. Many Kings, Queens and other prominent people are laid to rest here. Definitely worth the admission price. Great audio guide to point out what you are seeing as you walk around.

Friendly welcome. I attended evensong last Friday. The vergers were very welcoming and courteous, not just to me but to everyone who was arriving for the service. This friendliness is unusual in famous places such as the Abbey. Good for them! A small additional point. If you want to hear the magnificent Abbey organ it seems that Fridays evenings is the organist's night off! Everything was sung (beautifully) by the choir a capella.

Amazing!. We weren't planning on going inside Westminster Abbey but wow were we glad we did! The place is just amazing. The architecture, the history, the stunning Lady Chapel. We were starting to get neck ache from looking up so much! Whilst going into The Cloisters is a wonderfully tranquil experience that seems a world away from the hustle and bustle in Parliament Square. Will definitely be going back!

Interesting, but very crowded. Loads of things to see - many tombs of previous Kings & Queens, lots of little chapels, ornate ceilings etc. However, crowds did not seem to be managed well and felt like we were on a production line, following endless people around the route. Very little information was provided (if you didn't get the audio guide), so either you had to ask members of staff about a specific piece, or fight back through the crowds to attempt to get an audio guide.
Evensong. Attended Sunday Evensong at Westminster Abbey while visiting London for the first time. This was an uplifting experience, with prayer and song within the beautiful Abbey.

Stunning. You'll definitely want to set aside a couple of hours to fully appreciate Westminster Abbey. Take advantage of the audio tour and listen to presentations on the sections that interest you most. Even if you're not into history, the beauty of the art and architecture of this place will keep you enthralled. Westminster Abbey is a "must see." (And the cloisters and garden areas are nice spots to take a break from the crowds.)
Very Busy But good. We had a great time. So much to see. If we were to go again, I would strongly recommend going early in the day to avoid the crowds. But a great time.

Coronations, Kings & Poets. A trip to London isn't complete without seeing the Abbey. This was our second visit in two years and I must say this one was much more enjoyable. We wandered aimlessly last time trying to see everything through the crowds of people. We were there at exactly the same time of years as two years ago and yet it was much less crowded. We paid admission of 17 Pounds each and an additional 5 pounds each for a private tour. The private tour was well worth it, so informative and such a great guide. Because we are Canadian and members of the Commonwealth the guide sat us in the chairs reserved for the Canadian High Commisioner in the choir. The building, those buried there, the coronation chair, the stained glass and the history make this an incredible part of your trip to London.

Hanging with the "Royals". I found myself with nothing to do on a Wednesday afternoon near Parliament Square and decided to visit Westminster Abbey. It normally closes at 3:00 or 3:30 but on Wednesdays its open to 6:00. There was a line which is usual and a certain number of people are allowed in at a time. The price is "pricey" @ 20 or 17 for seniors and youth. Children are even less. There is also a group price but group tours are only at certain times. It is well organized and audio tapes are available. It is also an active church so portions were roped off for people praying. It is a spectacular Gothic Church which goes back to 1245 although coronations have been done there since 1000. They have used the same throne since 1308. However most of the church is a cemetery with both aboveground and below ground burials. Henry III is the oldest Royal burial but there is also Edward I, Edward II, Richard II, Henry V, Edward VI, Mary I, Elizabeth I [Mary and Elizabeth, enemies in life are buried near each other] and Charles II. English History is everywhere at Westminster Abbey- Charles Darwin, Richard Hakluyt, Robert Adam, Charles Dickens, Samuel Johnson, Benjamin Disraeli; and Geoffrey Chaucer. It might get a little confusing without an audio and people are walking in all different directions. Its a spectacular church with lots of history. If you know British History, its a series a rediscoveries. If you have no interest in history, it might n be worth the 20. Kids may get bored. It can get hot. Gift shop is very nice.

Attend the worship ceremony for free. By attending the worship ceremony you won't have to stand in line long and it is free.Just find out when the ceremonies take place. Just tell the guard at the entrance that you want to attend the service.

Stunning!!!!!. If there is only 1 thing you have time for, Westminster Abbey has to be it. This place is stunning and has so much history. Your a basically walking into a royal cemetery. Make sure you grab the free audio tour guide headsets. The events that went on in there and standing inside the abbey where it all happened its breath taking. It is included in the London Pass and you can by pass the ticket line, which is nice on busy days. You will spend at least 2 hours there if you visit every area. My favorite place in the United Kingdom.

Must See in London. It is not cheap but Westminster Abbey is a must see in London. The Abbey is huge. Kings & Queens are buried throughout as well as many famous Britons, e.g., Isaac Newton & Charles Darwin. Expect queues.

Days out.. Never been to the abbey before. Found this very interesting. There is tour guides if you need them and also an audio guide. It has some very interesting resting place of royalty and memorials to some very famous poeple. The tomb of the unknown warrior is a must see and is emotional. Well worth a visit.

Be Sure to Make Sure the Abbey is Open!. My second visit to this iconic abbey and you see more on the second visit. Make sure you get the head set narration and by booking online, you get head of line priviledges.

Amazing. Well worth a visit. I tend to go and wander round the building just taking my time looking BUT on this occasion i would say having the audio system to listen too while going through this amazing building is a must. The sculpture work inside and out was just stunning. If you go to London I would highly recommend a trip here

Magnificient Cathedral. Westminster Cathedral is magnificent! We arrived about 10 minutes prior to opening and had only about a 20 minute wait to enter. It was amazing inside. We so loved the complimentary head phones as they provided much greater insight into the history of this beautiful and historical church.

Beautiful but if you don't mind the ticket price. It looks beautiful both from the outside and inside, and I can go on and on explaining about all the amazing things about this place; but it might be more useful to mention the things that make the visit less than perfect!It is really expensive: 20 GBP/pp. It worked us for us since with 2 for 1 train promotion we just paid the price of one. We first went on a Tuesday only to realize the place was not open though the website said it was open. They have a bag search at the entrance and not that they do it thoroughly but if you have lots of stuff in your bag, they make you move them around and take them out of the bag (not so fun with items such as underwear). Although to buy ticket online, you have to purchase it for a certain date and time, it doesn't seem that they really keep track of the number of people inside. when we visited, the place was packed which made moving around, standing and reading stuff a bit difficult.Note: Photography is not permitted inside the abbey.

Magnificent. Toured the Abby and attended and Evensong service there. What a stunning building. So much history and beauty. Do try to attend the 5pm Evensong service and hear the choir....they are wonderful.

Our Favorite Abbey. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit to Westminster Abbey. The abbey is absolutely breathtaking and the history is just unbelievable. It does cost to enter and it is very popular, so expect crowds. Audio guides are a must to truely appreciate.
Amazing!. This Abby is beautiful and so full of history. I could have stayed all day! I would recommend buying your tickets in advance because you get priority entry thus less waiting.

Visit it for free!. If you want to visit the Abbey for free, you may try to go when a mass is being taken place. They don't charge you to pray. Otherwise, for regulars visitors, they charge 25 pounds. Quite expensive! But, it's worthwhile.

Engrossing. Plan to spend quite a long time at Westminster Abbey. The chapels alone take time to view well. The whole place is stuffed with fascinating history, beautiful sculptures, amazing architecture. If you're planning to see Big Ben and the Houses of Parliament, add this can't-miss opportunity to your schedule and bring away beautiful memories.

Beautiful church. We have the London pass p, so the entrance was quick even though the line was long. Once inside they are very organized you follow the path and listen the audio guide. You will be able to see the chapels and the tombstones of people such as Issac Newton, Jane Austen, etc. I admired the stained glass windows and the magnificent ceilings. I will take you at least 2hrs to see it.
London visit . Wow!!!!! Beautiful, grand and awe inspiring. The simple beauty and magnificence, especially the Lady Chapel is a true sight to behold.

So much history!. I really enjoyed my visit here however I found it a really odd mix of monuments tombs statues and memorials that felt disconnected I have not found this in any other Cathedral I have been in before.
A beautiful Place. The Abbey is stunning and something that you should go see. Sadly, you cannot take pictures. There is so much history and beauty here, it should not be missed.

A Godly place. We worshipped there on Sunday morning Matins and Sunday afternoon. Otherwise, the Abbey is closed to tourists on Sunday, but worshipping there was the highlight anyway. The boys' choir and majestic organ seemed to make the very wall vibrate. Later in the week we took the self-guided audio tour, which was excellent. Take your time!

An eye opening experience into the intricate webs of Royalty over the years. A visit to Westminster Abbey gives you a good understanding of the politics of royalty over the ages. In addition the Abbey is a beautiful building to enjoy. A perfect attraction for a miserably wet London day as we found out.
1990s. How can one talk about the Big Ben without mentioning the Westminster Abbey. Grand building . Houses of parliament are located nearby.

Stunning. A wonderful experience. This church is simple stunning. It is well organised for the amount of tourist, a very busy church. Make sure you book ahead so you can avoid the ques. Well worth a visit. The people buried there will amaze you.

So much history, a must visit. Westminster Abbey was a royal mausoleum for centuries and became a national shrine owing to its location next to the Palace of Westminster. Since 1066 most kings and queens of England have been crowned in the Abbey. The funeral of Winston Churchill and that of Diana, Princess of Wales also took place here. We had booked prior to our visit and took an audio tour. There is so much information available that the audio guide is a must although parts can be skipped if you wish. We spent around 2 hours visiting which was enough given the crowds and the slow progress. A visit to Westminster Abbey is a great way to hear and see so much history at one time that a chance to visit should not be missed

Beautiful! . They give you little speakers and you can press the numbers on the thing for which parts of the abbey you want to know more of as you're walking through. Really awesome. Staff is nice and there's so much to look out! I'd definitely recommend!

See where the kings and queens are crowned. This is where all of the kings and queens of England (or now the United Kingdom) are crowned. The Gothic architecture is beautiful. Plus kings, queens, scientists, writers, and lots of other famous English people are buried at Westminster Abbey. This is a must see for history buffs! There's also a nice cafe on site where the monks used to reside called the Cellarium. I'd recommend getting the the London Pass to visit this and many other places in London.

Breathtaking . I had been to London previously but had not visited Westminster Abbey. Being in London for 3 days at the end of a 4 week trip we had seen many churches and abbeys but we were not prepared for the beauty and history of Westminster Abbey....it was breathtaking. Would love to visit again and spend longer here, a place not to miss.

large and impressive, but not really beautiful. This is a must-see attraction in London, and I'm glad we have visited it. Of course, everyone has heard about Poet's Corner and all of the famous people buried here. And the church is gargantuan. But very little effort was put into making it beautiful. There is an exquisite section behind the main alter, which is dedicated to the fallen from the Battle of Britain and it has a gorgeous ceiling, but much of the church is austere. Also, the oldest parts of the building are apparently unstable, and consequently off-limits. So it's worth peeking into, but I wouldn't spend too much time here.

Westminster Abbey. You cannot get into the Abbey without booking prior. Go to Westminster bridge...amazing...you will get photos from there of Big Ben and the Abbey. Dont waste money on tours...it is all in front of you....

Amazing history. The audio tour of the Abbey takes about 3 hours to go through completely. It was very crowded and difficult to get through some of the spaces because of the number of people. The audio tour was very thorough with interesting bits of information. We used our London Pass to get in which allowed us to bypass the long line. Was amazed though at the number of cobwebs and dust throughout the building.

History everywhere. So crowded inside, it made this large building seem small. Shame. Everyone wants to visit Westminster and with all the history inside it's understandable. There are other cathedrals to visit if you really want to get a feel for these buildings. That said, there is so much to see inside Westminster that it's easy to be overwhelmed. My reason for visiting was to see " Edward the Confessor"'s tomb. I love history and this is an important of English history. Lucky for me there was a world prayer service and was able to go up to see it. Normally it's a closed area and the tomb can't be seen from floor level.Speaking of floor, be careful! Due to it's age, it's very uneven and the crowds are not very friendly. You will get stepped on. Come on American tourists be nicer. This is a site where you take your time not plow through.

An absolute must. Don't be mistaken than Westminster Abbey is just like all the other churches you'll visit in Europe. The rich history, the burial places competing for space and attention, the remarkable variations in decoration, function and age make Westminster an utterly unique experience. Everyone will find something breath taking and special-relating to a favorite person from history or the arts. Ambling through with the self guided headphones was easy and enjoyable-the snippets of music and detail in the tape quite lively. Note-the cellar cafe at the exit serves excellent lunch, coffee and cakes!
Verger's Tour. Excellent! Very interesting and informative. A must do as you see far more than you would expect. Amazing history brought to life!

Masterpiece. What can one say about Westminster Abbey that has probably not been said a thousand times before. The beauty and history of the Abbey are overwhelming. The individual taped devices they give you provide a very well done tour of the building and describe the history as you go along. There are a great many kings and queens entombed here but personally I spent a few moments at the gravesite of Laurence Olivier who is one of my favorite actors. This place is a "must see" but I recommend getting tickets online in advance and then getting there early as the crowds do build up.

Choral service is a highlight. We went to a 5pm Evensong service, not for the service so much as the whole experience in this awe inspiring building. The boys were on tour and we had the lay vicars singing. It really was a moving and memorable experience, especially being seated in the ancient carved wood choir stalls - what an unexpected privilege. Highly recommended for anyone, whether religious or not. If you get there early and join the line outside at about 4pm, you should get to sit in the stalls which makes the event even more special.

Incredible to see. It was an eye-opener to see walk through Westminster Cathedral, which is the venue for so many royal life events. It's a surprise to find yourself standing on the graves of so many famous people who have shaped the history of Great Britain. We saw the sport where Oliver acromwell was buried for a few years until they dug him up and "executed " him for treason. We saw where Mary Queen of Scots was buried, adjacent to the burial place of her rival Elizabeth I. Entry was expensive, but worth it.
Check opening times. We were there at about two on a Saturday afternoon, and it was closing very soon, so we weren't allowed in

Don't miss this amazing place!. We love history and especially British history! We were able to attend a service at Westminster Abbey and it was a wonderful way to end our anniversary vacation! We sat in the same spot that kings, queens, presidents and others had sat, over hundreds of years. There are many famous people buried here and the cathedral is full of wonderful gothic architecture and sculpture. Don't miss it.

So rich in history. The history of this church is amazing. Take the time to walk around and see all the monuments within the church. And take the time to enjoy the outside of the building as its stunning.

Westminster Abbey. It was a most amazing place to visit - well worth the entry fee. The architecture and historical significance has to be seen to be believed. There are self-guided tours with hand held recordings of each area to assist if you are not with a tour company. A must see!

Absolutely Beautiful and informative. We loved our visit here. It was a total shame that photos weren't allowed. It seems like an outdated policy that is designed to make money but we still enjoyed our visit.

One of the most beautiful places I've ever seen!. The visit is expensive: at a whopping 20£, it's definitely not cheap, but it's worth every penny. One of the most glorious, breathtakingly beautiful places I've ever had the chance to visit. Included in the admission fee is also an audioguide: extremely clear, useful, and informative. Don't forget to visit the little cloister and the garden, if they are open. Also had the chance to see the tombs of Geoffrey Chaucer, Charles Dickens, Georg Handel... and the commemorative plaques of Jane Austen, the three Bronte sisters, Shakespeare, just to name a few. Very emotional and beautiful visit.The Abbey shop is extremely well stocked, they carry something for every budget (from 1.5£ postcards to 200£ jewellery). Must visit if you're in London and have a couple of hours to spare!

Beautiful . We loved that we decided to actually do the tour of The Abbey. The history is astounding. Took us about an hour and felt so fast. They have restroom towards the end. Next time I would like to do a service. The outside is amazing but I do recommend going in as well. Lots of final resting places for kings, queens etc.

A church. This is a church that has over 700 years of history attached to it. This is where all the coronations of the Royal takes place.This church still holds regular prayers and all people are welcome. If you visit when there is not service, there are tickets you have to purchase.

Beautiful, historic & awesome!. This is a historical must-see! The tour is self-guided and the entire place is absolutely beautiful. I wish we could've taken more pictures inside but photos are not allowed. It's one of those places that you see on TV and read about and it was exciting to be able actually experience it.

Well Worth Your Time. We were standing in front of Westminster Abbey. There was the sign: 20 pounds to enter. 20 pounds? As a family, that could easily be more than $100 to visit. Could it be worth it?Well, the conclusion we came to was that we were in London. Of course we were coming to Westminster Abbey. And it is a fantastic place to visit. An incredible building. A historic building. You literally walk among some of Britain's most historic figures.There are also some quiet corners. My favorite place was not in the nave with the crowds. We walked into the cloisters which were nearly empty. Seeing the gardens and the views of the exterior was extraordinary.I think that the admission cost is exorbitant. But is it worth it? Yes. It is.
a great building. a great building old one its close to the big ben so when you are visiting the big ben visit the westmenistis abbey as well the closest station is ( guess what ) westminster station

Beautiful. The audio helps some, but.... Keep your eyes peeled, and come with patience if you are looking for a specific grave stone or tomb. We looked a long time for one, and nearly gave up before finding it under a bunch of chairs. However, you just can't overlook the amazing history contained, and preserved at the Abbey. Seeing the 700+ year old tombs of Kings and queens was awe inspiring. I really don't understand why they have men like Darwin who hated God buried there, but it most likely stems from their shift at some point from the worship of God , to the worship of man. You can see lots of adoration of generals, statesman etc... exhibited within. I still recommend it, though. But I would add we liked St. Paul's much more.
Not an Abbey anymore.. Get there about 10 am and the queues are not bad. Afternoon s are very busy. If you are having trouble finding someone just ask the staff they are very helpful.

Expensive but a Must-See. Westminster Abbey really is a must-see for anyone visiting London. It is loaded with history, both distant and recent. It's definitely surreal to see the place where Prince William as well as Queen Elizabeth herself were married, and the very spot where the coronation took place in 1953. Here you will also see the sacred tombs of Edward III, the magnificent Elizabeth I & Mary, Queen of Scots, among others.The audio guide is great and thorough. Entrance is a little on the expensive side, but with the London pass it was well worth it.

Read your history books before you visit. They had run out of audio guides so we just wandered around...Most of the names I didn't know who the people were and I felt like I should have studied before my visit. The Actual place is Very gody looking and graves are EVERYWHERE its liek they ran out of space so started burying people under the floor. It is beautiful..but do your British history homework first or you will feel lost as I did.

Simply beautiful. As an American you see places like this in books and movies. To actually visit this place is truly awe inspiring. The history, pomp and circumstance, and revelry just ooze, in the best way possible.

Spectacular. We bought a LondonPass so we had access to lots of attractions. The Abbey was spectacular. There was a short line to get in, but well worth the wait. My advise with any of the attractions is to buy skip the line tickets. LondonPass has lots of these.

Fantastic history. Highly recommend this tour. If there's one place to go this is the place. We downloaded the tour audio guild so you can go at own pace and listen with own headset. Can't take photos but the gift shop is a must stop.

Time travel is real!!! 😁 Jaw-dropping experience!. WOW is the word I can only use with this place! Wow, this place has so many royal and influential people buried there! Crypts, crypts and moooooo crypts!! WOW, the royals (all of them) were married right where I was standing (should have worn a fascinator)!!! Whaaaa!?!?! WOW, the architecture!!! WOW the history!!! It's just amazing! My husband kept me, the history nerd, in stitches all the way through the cathedral. Husband quotes of the day: "I don't like walking on all these dead people...." and "This isn't a church, it's a funeral home!" Hahaha!!!! He's a nut!

Great London Iconic Site. Westminster Abbey is somewhat dwarfed by Big Ben and the Houses of Parliament as they are so close, but this is just an iconic place in one of the biggest cities in the world where so much history has taken place. If you could go in the church it would be much better, but unfortunately, they do not allow it. However, what they don't tell you is if you go through the school square on the northwest side of the Abbey, you can get in an see more than the average tourist that sticks to the outside perimeter.
Very moving. On the day we were there they had a Christian Communion Service at 1230 open to anyone. It was very moving to recieve communion in such a historic church. It brought tears to my eyes.

Inspiring. This massive cathedral is beyond imagination. Seeing the graves of so many notables and walking among kings and queens and statesmen and poets and religious leaders, etc... was fascinating.

Pretty amazing. We went through the Abbey the first time we were in London and took the opportunity to go back. Amazing history. I wish there was more information on some of the non-famous people "buried" there but still very interesting and well worth the price (I think it was 18 pounds). A bit crowded and it is common for people to walk across a memorial that you are clearly reading so just expect that and try not to let it get to you. Really a fascinating place.
Loved this visit. Very enjoyable visit to a well known site. Would recommend booking tickets ahead, avoids waiting in queues.
Pricey. Annoyied we had to pay £20 to go in a sacred place should be donations but its nice in there. I wouldnt say was worth the money.
Too small and too expensive. My memory of that monument was from 1988 and I thought it was bigger and larger. And paying 20£ is quite expensive, even if people Inside were very polite

A Moving Experience. The beauty and history of this place is awe inspiring. The architecture is splendid. I enjoyed seeing the final resting places of so many kings, queens, artists, scientists, and writers. I especially liked seeing the humble grave marker of my hero, Charles Darwin. Be sure to pick up the inexpensive but quality Westminster Abby Souvenir Guide at the gift shop.

Historical Westminster Abbey. Nice to see all the famous headstones and the beauty of the abbey and recognise the bits seen on TV and lots of references to well known historical figures that tie in with British history, however £20 per adult is a lot for entry. We queued up to enter which was fine. The abbey was rather packed with tourists making it difficult to move around with a buggy or wheelchair. We ate at the restaurant in the abbey. Meal for two adults was £55, and nothing special. The soup was the nicest dish.

Not just another church. Westminster Abbey's main pulling power is that it is so steeped in history and familiar names are everywhere - it's like a roll-call of English history. Even those tourists rather jaded by 'yet another church' should go here. It is more museum than church. Wonderful architecture. Try to get there early to beat the queues.

Incredible building - a must see in London. One of the few breathtaking buildings to see in person, along with St. Paul's Cathedral in London. Really a must see while in London. Didn't get a chance to tour inside but the views from the outside are just impressive.

Free if you're attending mass. Expensive otherwise.. On a quick trip to London I wanted to see Westminster Abbey. I was on a fairly tight budget, and I went during the day and it was about 20 pound to get in. Yeesh. I opted to have a few pints instead. When I walked by later that evening I noticed they were having mass. Putting on my best church face, I walked in and was seated in the choir seating. While i'm not very much of a church goer, the experience of having mass delivered in such a historic church, in the choir benches that are so iconic was just awe inspiring.
My London Vacay. Words cannot describe how beautiful and rich in history this church is. No photos allowed. The audio tour is so informative. A definite must do!
Beautiful building.... I didn't go inside but just walking around it is amazing to observe the architecture of the place. It is just beside Big Ben, so there is no way to miss it.
A must see!!. This is absolutely an awesome experience. The architecture is absolutely spectacular! The history is and beauty is beyond beautiful!

Inspiring. Well worth the time to visit and explore. We booked our tickets on line so just walked into the Abbey. The audio guide is very helpful and informative and allows you to explore at your own pace. We had previewed the guide from the Abbey site which we both found useful. There is a lot to see and experience here so plan at least 2 to 3 hours. We returned later in the day for an evensong service - about 30 minutes - which was very memorable and allows you to experience the Abbey fulfilling it's intended purpose.

A must for history buffs!!. This was one of the "I have to go there" places on our recent trip to Europe!! Not only is the building an iconic and beautiful landmark in London, but full of history. The abbey is the burial place of so many important people in history - Edward I The Elder & wife, Henry III, Edward I Longshanks & wife Eleanor of Castile, Henry VII and Elizabeth of York, Mary I Tudor, and many more. Unfortunately you are not allowed to take pictures in the abbey, but I will always have the memories of visiting this historical place where many of my ancestors are buried. Go early as it gets packed with people fast!!

Breathtaking. Queued to gain entry but only took about 15-20 mind. Used a two for one national rail voucher so entrance fee was good value. Free audio guides read by Jeremy irons give a fascinating insight throughout the tour of the abbeys history. Can get busy and probably wouldn't recommend this with small children

Interesting, but .... Deciding it was past time to visit this great British historical icon, we paid our £20 entry fee and followed the pre-determined route. Lots of famous names and burial places but the staff were not welcoming nor approachable. The historical interest had value but to be honest, our money could have been better spent. It was disappointing photos were banned - why? Flash photography I understand, but non-flash? What is the harm?
Monumental!. Pictures don't do it justice! A must see when you visit London. Make sure to check online for public viewing times, sometimes they change.

Priceless . What a place. If you want to step back in time and experience what it might have been like visit the Abbey. To find words to describe the building itself fail me. You are bound to be impressed with its grandeur. See the burial place of kings and queens amazing. The staff were very informative and obviously enjoy working in this Abbey. Well worth the visit you will not be disappointed.

Mixed feelings. A stunningly beautiful building but if you have not a real interest in seeing every part of the abbey or something in particular, like a tomb r church don't pay full fee, go to a service. It is expensive if not
Always a destination. Each time we go to London, Westminster is on our list.I do wish there was an option for a second more lengthy and detailed audio tour.

Sublime music. Go on a Sunday for a servic it is free and you get to hear wonderful music in the most beautful setting. This is truly one of the most fantastic Churches in the whole of the UK the only place with better music in my opinion is Kings College Cambridge. The history of the place and the feel make it a truly exceptional place to visit.
An excellent site. The guided route with audio was very well done. You can proceed at your own pace and learn about the history of the cathedral. It's a fascinating way to spend a couple of hours.

Just awesome. If you haven't been to Westminster Abbey on a visit to London then you are missing something special. Just to wander through it at your leisure and think of all the history. It's incredible a must see.
Beautiful Church. This was a beautiful church with rich history. It has graves of English monarchs and influential people. Charles Darwin and Sir Isaac Newton are buried here.

A Must See. The magnitude and beauty of this building are simply breathtaking. One wonders how they actually constructed this place back in days when nothing was mechanised. The Abbey choir is the finest I have ever heard and I would recommend trying to attend a service in which the choir sings. The history contained in this building is truly fascinating.
Free Concert. Check the Abbey website for a listing of free organ concerts. We were able to attend one and it was a treat! Beautiful music- a very memorable experience. Arrive early for best seating.

Sneak a peek and get an experience. Have been to the Abbey before but this time I was travelling with my son who hasn't. We both agreed that entrance fee was rather steep, so we decided to go to a service and hence sneak a little look. You can only see part of the Abbey, but it's free and you also get a glimpse of English church life. Everybody is welcome, you are expected to dress sort of decent (like not singlets on women....) but that's all.

Thanks for nothing.. We unfortunately arrived on a Tuesday to discover that the abbey is closed on Tuesday's. We should have done our research more thoroughly. A staff member told us the abbey would open again the next day. We arrived the next day (Wednesday) just after mid-day. The abbey was closed again. A staff member then informed us that the abbey closes at 12pm on Wednesdays!!!!! We have to accept that we should have checked prior, however this building is a CHURCH. The opening hours are ridiculous for such an important place. Ensure you check when it IS open before you go. We missed out completely.

Stay for Evensong. We arrived too late for the tour but were able to attend the evening prayer service called Evensong. This proved to be a far more enriching and authentic experience. Check the schedule at the entrance to see the hours of the service then get in line and tell the attendant you are there for the service.

Great for History Lovers. Took in the Abbey while in London. Beautiful building and location. Line ups were quite long, so if you don't have time you can take in the adjacent St.Margarets, which is also free and not so crowded.

great historical place to visit. i enjoyed my visit here but was disappointed that no photography was allowed. the architecture is magnificent and see the tombs of many kings, queens and many famous poets

Awe Inspiring Cathedral. Definitely get a guided tour as you will learn a lot more about the history plus you will get access to the inner nave. This is one of the most astounding cathedrals in the world and a must see above all else. Even casual students of history will see many of the characters they have read about buried within the Abby, everyone from statesmen, to scientists to poets can be found along with kings and queens of England. It makes history come alive!
Steeped in history and just fantastic.. We love this visit, with all the pomp and history that you can almost FEEL when entering. Best with some sort of guide so you don't miss things!!

Where have all the craftsmen gone. The details in the architecture is incredible and all done with out the benefit of computers and diesel cranes. Next time I'm bringing a pair of opera glasses so I can zoom in on the details that are up high. The history of the building and its occupants (crypts) is amazing.

Loved the history but disappointed by price. I was looking forward to visiting Westminster Abbey for a long time, and finally decided to plan it out one day. I was disappointed and put off by how expensive the admission price is (would be interesting to know how much it costs to keep the abbey in working order and how much profit they are making) but anyone with a love for England's history please come and visit, a beautiful place to be - absolutely steeped with history.

Wow Westminster. This place was awesome. I saw Edward the Confessor's tomb. The coronation floor where the coronation ceremony takes place. Lots of inscriptions and memoriums. Very good security. It was so magical. Poets corner was inspiring from Chaucer to Shakespeare, Tennyson to Burns. History was every where you looked. They had a garden where you could sit. Outside as I was leaving a lady bug flew onto my arm and didn't seem to want me to leave. I didn't want to leave! There was the oldest door in England. The room where Kings met with their subjects.

You have to see the Abbey if in London.... It along with the Tower of London and Windsor Castle were all commissioned by William the Conquerer over 1000 years ago. One of the best know sites in London and something anyone should see while touring the city.It is beautiful inside and some of England's most famous kings, queens, writers, poets, and politicians are buried here. While I personally think it resembles other large cathedrals I've visited in France and Europe, it is a very historical site and a place you must visit at least once.

Walking Through History.. An amazing place with so much history. We spent two hours which is not long enough, so much to take in. Audio guides are available & worth using. The décor is out of this world.

Incredibly busy but a must see.. Certainly lives up to expectations, Westminster Abbey has history by the bucketful. Poet't corner for literature aficionados. Kings and queens, lords, ladies and ordinary folk. Don't miss it.
X5PILOT . What a wonderful example of architecture! Also again as everything in London...very crowded! Take lots of photos!

A must while visiting London. To be walking through so much history is overwhelming. With the countless kings and queens entombed throughout, it may take a while and you try to take it all in. There are audio guides for use in many languages. Also bathrooms at the end of the tour. A must see!
Great. It was a really good experience. The abbey is beautiful and the best part is that the audio tour is given by Jeremy Irons (if you choose it in English).

Awesome. When over 3300 people are buried here- you know this is a big magnificent place. WE paid for the tour which was so worth it.
Our guide was fabulous- so passionate about his work.
The Abbey is a jewel- don't miss it.
Iconic site. This is a beautiful church with stunning architecture and well-known history. I love that history is still being made here as well!

Walking in history - must-see. Not only the architecture is very impressive. If you step inside you literally step into history. There is so much to see here and there is so much that happened here (remember the royal wedding 2011?). There are ceremonies held here that are historic events themselves and there are objects and parts of the building to explore that give you an overview of English history through the ages. Look out for the burial sites and marvel at how much money and artistic talent was spent on memorial sights. Take care not to step on the memorial for the unknown soldier. And - most of all - do it on your own time (take a seat if needed); there is so much to see. Avoid peak times and large tourist groups crammed around certain objects of interest (just come back later). Take the guide with you. And enjoy! Suitable for all except infants.

Soo much for the eye to see!. I could hardly take in all the historic eye candy - there is soo much to see and so many beautiful sculptures and architecture. Getting a guide is almost imperative as you would miss so much without it. It was fairly crowded but we were able to walk around and get close to many of the sites. There are many many historical figures buried here and is a beautiful abbey
BRILLANT. So much history and such an amazing building. A must see. Amazing to see the resting places of the kings and the Coronation Chair. Huge queues so buy a pass - you get in faster
Not Handicap friendly. Although historically fascinating, the tour is not easily done if you have difficulty walking. Lots of places to sit and audio info is part of entry price.

Nice but lots of room for improvement . Interesting tour but a very real lack of information. Audio guides were seriously lacking in detail. Need to get there very early to have enough time to do tour as it closes very early in afternoon. Worth a visit.

Beautiful but pricey. We went first thing one morning. No lines which was surprising but having come from Paris, we didn't expect to have to pay for just quick visit. We know understand the reason, Westminster relies on the funds for its up keep. Once inside it is just like a movie set, with so many queens buried there. Loved poets corner and the memorial to the unknown soldier. Great gift shop too!

Went for Evensong. I didn't go to Westminster as a tourist, but went for Evensong service. It was very peaceful, the service was lovely, and the organ music and choir were magnificent. Go for a quiet moment of contemplation and reflection.
Amazing place. You have to visit this Abbey.....it is amazing to see the actual place where the Coronation of Kings and Queens happens.....and the Royal Weddings.....quite interesting

Lovely sight with Big Ben. Took in Big Ben and London eye in the same visit. The evening view and night view are wonderful. Be sure to arrive after 6 and stay on till 8 to catch both scenes in Sept. A must see place when in London.
Tons of history - pricey but worth it. Very incredible site, lots of info to see and the audio tour is very nice. It is expensive but as a one time item worth it.
Beautiful church . Beautiful church... Very big... Must visit... But check the timings before you visit because it close at 3.00 pm... Close to big ben and Buckingham place.... A must visit place.
A London Treasure. Everyone should take the time to visit this amazing place. So much history packed into this, in some ways unusual structure.

Historic, iconic, ancient, it's all here.. We all grew up knowing of this hallowed building and seeing events held there on TV.
Well the grandeur of the place doesn't disappoint.
I'm not religious and I still found it to be a profound record of time and history.
Concert. Go for a free organ concert on Sunday. I felt the sound in my stomach (and I think organ is not fully functional). Much better than the organ in Notre Damme.

The History of England is here. A beautiful historic building, well laid out for visitors. Expensive but worth the charge in our opinions. We usually avoid audioguides but the one here was excellent and definitely enhanced our visit. One of the MUST SEE sites in London.
Don't miss. Beautiful. Don't miss this. So full of history-fascinating. It's a beautiful cathedral and like taking a stroll through Dngland's history.
Must go! . This place is filled with history and awe-inspiring architecture. You can easily spend an afternoon here. Over 2000 people buried under the floors here. A must-visit!

Amazing site. We purchased tickets in advance and were able to get in very quickly when it opened at 9:30am. I highly recommend you get there as early as possible because the crowds gradually increased and we only visited on a Tuesday. The minute of prayer was a treat to experience. The audio tour was informative, but succinct with Jeremy Irons narrating no less. There is a nice cafe within the cathedral to grab breakfast following or a cup of tea.

Favorite spot in London. This was by far my favorite sight in London. The amount of history here is unfathomable! The audio guide is helpful, but having someone guide you would be preferred. There is so much to see, you could spend an entire day in here. No pictures allowed inside the Abbey. This is a must see to believe!

Enjoyable visit. I enjoyed the history of this place although I felt very odd walking on people's graves. It just seems disrespectful to me. The audio guides were very informative. No food or drink inside and you can buy tickets online before you go. No photography.

A Moving Experience. There's not a lot more I can add to the excellent reviews for Westminster Abbey. It is a beautiful and humbling experience visiting this important, historic building. I would highly recommend taking a Verger tour of the Abbey; the Verger tours are fascinating and delivered in a more personable way than the audio guides. During our visit we joined a Verger tour led by the amazing Cath. What a joy she made this tour! Cath was warm, charming, kind, personable, highly knowledgeable, intelligent, amusing and had a great sense of humour. She kept our group together, always keeping track of everyone. Cath, if you do happen to see this review, we were from the 10:30 morning group on Sept. 21 which largely consisted of Canadians. I can't thank you enough for our wonderful experience at Westminster Abbey..

Such heritage. After walking down through St James park we came across Westminster Abby which was splendid architecture and such history with all the noble dignitary crossing the steps into the Abby. well worth a visit even if you do not go inside.....although if you have a travel card it has free entrance to such venues.

Stunning!. This Abbey is absolutely beautiful and full of such great historical information. The tour itself took nearly 2 hours as we were quite slow with appreciating everything. I continually found myself looking around imagining all the past events they referenced that were held at this building. The Coronation Chair was a very big highlight even though it was at the very end.

Crowded walk-through on your own tour with audio guide. The audio guide and map here are essential to learn about what you're seeing as there is so much here. The history is fascinating and extensive. There is a long security line to get through and then people were slow moving through the various areas but this is a must-see of London for tourists.

Highlight of London!. Westminster Abbey is incredible - so much history and a beautiful sacred site. Right from the moment you step over William Wilberforce's grave, you know you are in for a treat. The staff are very friendly and helpful and the headset is pitched really well. Several times shivers went down my spine it was so breathtaking! Take your time and be in awe. Go into the gardens - a peaceful haven hidden in the centre of Westminster!

A Royal Church. Dead or alive, this is Royalty with a prayer. They baptize, marry, coronate, and bury Royalty at Westminster. A few commoners like poets, writers, and unknown solders, but the rest are Royals in the first degree. I suppose it is a must see but it looks better when it is on tv, I liked St Paul's better.
Tombs abound. This shows a fascinating look into a working church used as a burial place for the rich , royal and famous from many centuries past.

A literary nerd's paradise. This was my second trip to London but my first trip to Westminster Abbey. As entrenched as it is in English history, I was more eager to see the resting places and memorial markers to my favorite English authors. Jane Austin is not buried there, but there is a plaque for her. Charles Darwin is there as well as Issac Newton, (for you DaVinci Code fans). Then there were the kings and queens, famous and infamous throughout history. I love places like this. When you actually see the places or the tombs of those people you read about in history class, it makes it suddenly "real". I particularly enjoyed seeing Queen Elizabeth I's tomb. "Gloriana" herself! I was amused to learn that her older sister Queen Mary is buried immediately below here. As they fought so much during their lives, they are spending eternity together. The Abbey is a must, but it is about 20 pounds sterling entry fee. (It depends on the daily exchange rate, but I believed this would have been $25 or $26 US dollars) I had been doing research prior to the trip and knew that admission to London museums is free, (well, they do ask for good will donations). It is definitely worth it. They have guided tours but they also have the audio, self-guided. As th is is an active place of worship, access is affected by services. There are also hourly prayers offered by the clergy.

One of the icon 'must sees' in London. No trip to London would be complete without a visit to this iconic landmark. Fascinating history coupled with breathtaking architecture makes this a pleasant tourist experience.
Fantastic . We had a great family visit here. One of the guides really helped educate and inspire the children with his stories. Highly recommend.
Interesting piece of history. Interesting and exciting. Take the guided tour with the headset explanations. It is very useful and makes the visit much more interesting

Breathtaking!. Living history!! Words just cannot describe how beautiful and amazing Westminster Abbey is. I spent about 2 1/2 hours here and I think during that time my head was on a swivel trying to take it all in! We're so fortunate to have such a place to visit! The number of known people entombed here is very interesting too.

So much history in one place. Must see.. The audio tour is helpful but do not do the tour without your map. The signs for the audio tour are hard to see. The Abbey is very crowded. You wonder what will happen in the years to come. Well worth the visit.

Wonderful, but I curse the inventor of audio tours.. Westminster Abbey is a soaringly beautiful abbey. Were you to walk through it's splendidness unaccompanied it would be a wondrous place. Sadly for the individual tourist, that will never be the case. It gets busy, very busy. There are a lot of tourists in there. Tourists however are not the main problem. The main problem is the ubiquitousness of those blasted audio tour devices. Whatever happened to the good old days when if you wanted an audio tour you used headphones? Sure, it looked strange seeing hoards and hoards of people engrossed in headphones as opposed to looking around, but at least there was still silence. Now if you chose not to listen to the audio tour yourself all you can hear are almost silent snatches of words in a variety of languages. I imagine that's probably what purgatory is like; constantly roaming Westminster Abbey whilst listening to a Jeremy Irons tour on repeat.Ranting aside it is a beautiful place and well worth a (costly) visit. If you'd rather explore the abbey using your own senses I suggest taking earplugs.
Beautiful!. We enjoyed visiting the Westminter Abbey so much. It had so much interesting information and it was beautiful inside! Definitely recommend a visit!

Beautiful. I have seen Westminster Abbey on television before but it does not even begin to compare to seeing it in person. The architecture is beyond amazing. We could have spend days here and still not seen everything worth seeing here. We also had tea in the cafe here. I only wish I could have found and bought the tea we had there to bring home. It was wonderful. I am sure we will go back here again on another visit.
Amazing!. Westminster Abby is a must see attraction when visiting London. The history of this place is amazing.

Absolutely beautiful. Only in London are world class museums free and churches charge admission. That being said - the maintenance this magnificent building is worth twice the price of admission, There is so much history in this building that it is hard to know where to begin. They provide an excellent audio guide but I would suggest trying to get into one of the daily tours offered by the Warders - 5 or 6 pounds but well worth it. I would also highly recommend, even if you are not religiously inclined, to line up at the west gate around 4:15 to get into Evensong. The music is beautiful and the acoustics of the Abby make for a once in a lifetime experience.

Check our organ concerts. We decided not to take the full tour. Instead we went to the free Sunday afternoon organ concert. While there we walked around the cathedral and saw what we wanted. Organ sounds great in the big hall. Takes about 90 minutes.

Beautiful service. We passed here twice on vacation and the outside was impressive but we were able to get into the Sunday service and the inside was WOW. The history of the abbey was amazing. The burial tombs inside went back centuries and were awe inspiring. We were asked if we wanted to sit in the choir section, so we did. We were right next to the beautiful sounding choir and sat in seats that were used by royals and dignitaries...pretty cool. Services are posted and free to get into.

Just Amazing - Something not too be missed when you Visit London. Absolutely Awesome, one of the most beautiful church's I've ever seen,so much history. Always wanted to go here, seen it on TV so many times. Definitely a must see, hard to put it into words. :)
Historic building. Great to show visitors this historic building although sadly we had to settle for looking around the ornate outside as they could not afford the £20 per person entrance fee.
spacticular. what a wonderful building,full of history,its really is as magnificent as you would expect.inside tours dont run all the time so check the local guide.

Can't miss the history. Westminster Abbey is completely overwhelming! The amount of history in that place is so incredible. The audioguides were helpful but kinda took away from the experience a bit. Don't cheat yourself on time; we ended up spending nearly 4 hours but we were fairly thorough in exploring the building. It's expensive but worth it for the upkeep of the building. Lots of options in the giftshop as well.

1000 years of history. . Breathtaking, old and exciting. Must do. You will learn a lot about the history of London and religion in the U.K. Plus learning about the architecture and buried celebrities as Isaac newton and Darwin.

Exceptional Place to Visit - Very Historical. Definitely worth a visit; the only thing I wish we were able to do is take pictures but since it’s still a church in full use, pictures are not allowed. It was quite impressive to walk through and see the locations of where the monarchs were buried; especially Queen Elizabeth I, Mary, Queen of Scots, Henry VIII, etc. Definitely want to get the audio as it provides a wealth of information on the abbey and those buried within.

Awe inspiring. This Abbey is so historic on itself and then it is the burial place of hundreds of people who served their people in many ways. Almost all English royalty is buried there as well. The monuments and sculptures are fantastic. It reminds me of the burial place of all the kings of France, St. Denis Basillica.Takes hours to really see it all.

Amazing place of worship and history!. I'd heard about this place most of my life, but it was much more than I expected. Ornate, full of history, and yet, still a place of worship, where once each hour, guests are led in prayer. It was an awesome experience! ( photography was not allowed inside)

A must see. This an absolute must see if you are in London. The entry price includes an audio tour which is excellent. We took over an hour wandering around, being wowed by all the fabulous carvings, tombs etc that are there.Seeing where the Royal weddings, coronations and events take place is truly breathtaking.

Allow plenty of time. This is an absolute must visit in London. It is very costly to enter but so worth while. Give yourself plenty of time to do the audio tour and then to revisit the many things you will have missed along the way. The history in there is incredible as is the architecture. After seven months of travelling the world visiting many temples, cathedrals etc across the religions, I do rate this as extraordinary and would go back. If I return though, I will go to a service and enjoy the free entry - then will sit back and soak the place in

A Must See for History Lovers. There is so much history in this building as well as the building itself. If you are interested in history in general, the history of kings and queens or medieval architecture this is the place to visit.

Peace in middle of the city . The church environment and surroundings were peaceful despite long queue and crowded. Guides and information available were excellent. Love the peace after a long walk in the city!

Nice church. I'm not a fan of churches to begin with, but this is of course a "must-see" so we went. The history of the place is great and it is impressive, inside and out, but it's very dark and cluttered for my taste. I enjoyed seeing St. Paul's Cathedral much more.

Fantastic Visit. Dawn, my guide, my goodness, she loves her job, she really does!!! took me round the Abbey, Excellent knowledge, always prompting for audience questions. I thought she couldn't get any better until we came into Henry's Chapel, or as Dawn explained, the Ladies chapel, what she didn't know...... I doubt anyone could better her!

Unbelievable. It's hard to describe a place like Westminster Abbey. The fact that it was built centuries and centuries ago is amazing, considering the size of the structure and the materials used. The tombs, the history, Royal Weddings and Coronations, it all happens here. We followed the WA audio-guide and it was very helpful. We ate lunch at the restaurant and the food was very good.
Take the Verger's Tour!. The self guided tour is nice but pay the fee and take the Verger's tour to get into areas you can't see otherwise. And come back for Evensong service if you get the chance.

Kings, Dukes, Duchesses, oh my!. Another one of the more famous spots in London, this is also a must-see. Like many of the more popular sightseeing spots the abbey has free audio guides, so you can hear about things as you’re walking around. The abbey is used for coronations, wedding, and important funerals. Odds are you’ve seen it on TV, now you can see it in real life. There’s a lot of history and architecture here. There is also enough visula stimulation to keep your kids occupied for an hour or so. Remember, is is a church so keep your kids in check. Recommended.

Wonderful Abbey. Visiting the westminster abbey is excellent chance to dive into the British history. The monument is amazing the the audio guide gives you a full explanation on every single detail of the Abbey. Excellent place to vist

And icon in the city.. What more can be said about this incredible building in the midst of London. It has so much history that one visit will never satisfy you. You were standing in the midst of thousands of years of tradition. Not only that, but it possesses a wonderful religious dimension. Avoid the crowds by going around lunchtime.
Westminster Abbey. Great place, not to be missed. I would recommend paying the extra fee and taking the private tour. Lots of great information.

Historical British Church. Interesting to look at. I would recommend those coming from other countries to book and reserve in advance because the ques are very long at this place. I thought the self tours were okay. I prefer people led tours to inform tourists of historical interesting points.

Stunning!. Very beautiful, full of fascinating history, and a prayerful atmosphere despite being mobbed with tourists. Paths are well laid out and easy to follow, and the essential audio guide is first rate. Great gift shop, too.
A lot of history in one place. This is one of the most fascinating churches I have ever visited, so many important people buried there, you are not allowed to film inside, but the visit is worth it!

This can be a solom place. Visited here in 2014 and this year, had same feeling of the place it is a mausoleum not a church of worship . The architecture and art are amazing but I could not get around the fact every were you walked you were standing on someones burial place. Came back second time as first time visit was in peak of Holiday season and could not move in here. second time( This year was slightly off peak time ) and it was a lot better to observe the building. I does cost to get in but if you are sneaky do it on Sunday when services are going and attend the service then your in for nothing. Make sure you also go into the monastry and the litte church outside both very facinating
Amazing. This tour was absolutely beautiful, even breathtaking. They don't allow you to take pictures. The history and detail of the royal families for centuries is just...I don't have a word for it.
If you have the time it's well worth a visit. At 20 pounds it's a bit expensive but enjoyed seeing the graves of so many famous people of history including many royals.
A MUST SEE. Holds such great history and the sculptures are amazing. I felt like this was the heart of England. If you see one attraction in London this should be it!

A Must Do. This church is both beautiful and brimming with history. The audio guide was very good. We went on a Saturday afternoon and we had purchased our tickets online ahead of time. Our friend that hadn't pre-purchased ended up getting inside more quickly, but just by a few minutes. Both lines looked to be about the same length.A must do when in London!

Worth a visit. Like most sites in London, the entry fee is a bit much. But this one is worth a visit. Loads of history inside and loads of famous names to locate as you search around the burial sites. Entrance fee includes a very comprehensive audio guide.

Loved the Westminister Area. Of course you need to go here - we see it on TV all the time. It was a neat experience and a beautiful part of London - it is part of the history so you really need to go.
Unbelievable. The number and size of the tombs in this abbey must be seen to be believed. A truely awesome place, you could spend hours and never see everything.

this is England!. Westminster Abbey was first built, as I recall, around 860; and the history going into the place has not ceased; it is amazing to think of how many monarchs and lesser nobility were here; some to be crowned, some to be buried;and e cannot forget about the commoners, expecially in poets' corner;I won't even begin to name the burials here; suffice it to say that if you are interested in any phase of English history or literature, this is a must see place;and we cannot forget about the Abbey itself; magnificent architecture and grounds

Amazing Surprise. I knew the history of the abbey before my visit but I was not expecting the huge expanse it covers, nor the amount of history it contains. A bit expensive but so worth it because it goes on and on and on. Sadly no pictures are allowed in the main part of the building but it was worth seeing because the detail in it shows you how much artistic work went into it and what true craftsmen were involved in its building.

A walk through history. A must see site in London. We have visited on our own and most recently with a guided tour by London Walks. There is much to see and well worth taking a guided tour. We have been twice now and will likely go again as there is so much to see we feel we still have not seen it all.

Truly Magnificent. This is an absolute must see if you are in London. You can get tickets ahead of time that put you in the front of the line. It can be quite crowded and they don't allow photographs. The architecture, stained-glass windows and artwork are remarkable. This place basically captures most of the history of Britain and is a great learning experience. Plan on spending at least half a day.

A Thousand Years of History. Saw the Abbey with the "London Walks" tour. Highly recommended. The Abbey is both a spectacular building and a massive museum showing 1000 years of history. So many kings and queens and poets, artists, and scientists are buried or memorialized here, you could spend a whole day and still have more to see. Highly recommended!

Not to be missed. Westminster Abbey is so many things under one roof. As most, if not all, of us know, it is a church, a site of royal coronations, and a burial place of monarchs, national figures, poets, and other famous & important people. It has a lot of history and one should take time looking at every corner & section to appreciate it's beauty. Look down on the floor, too, as you could be stepping over Darwin's grave!
A Must See. The history in the abbey is fantastic. Next time we will book a tour in the abbey as I think you must miss out on so much information just doing it yourself.

Breath taking!. This was one of the high lights of our vacation. Being in a place where so much history has taken place, the coronation of the queen, Royal weddings, final resting place of so many poets, scientists, and royals. I felt truly overwhelmed and moved with all the beauty within. The people/guides are very knowledgeable and able to answer questions and audio guides available in several different languages. It is a must see!

History History History. Westminster Abbey is a time capsule of every name, figure, king, poet you've ever studied or seen portrayed in a cable historical drama. The Church itself is magnificent- especially the windows. But the history and the tombs make it a remarkable experience where history comes alive.

#1. This topped my list heading over as the history of the monarchy is here as well as Poet's Corner - now one of my favorite places to visit in the world. WORD!You can use the free app or they have free audio tours.
Just wow. Free commentary when you pay admission. They are used to handle a lot of people. Quick and effective.

So interesting. Four stars because I am comparing it to Paris' Notre Dame. And it smells like, well, a cemetery. But the sheer volume of crypts and memorials here are mind boggling. There are people buried all along under the floor. So you will be walking on their graves. I had a hard time with that! My mother raised me to not walk on graves.

An amazing abbey. It is an amazing abbey with so much history, wherever you look there are tombs and memorials to see. Audio guides and maps are provided so you can wander around at your leisure. My wife and I found it very moving to stand beside the tomb of the unknown soldier.

Most amazing tour. We elected for the Verger guided tour and it was so worth the extra £5 - you would just miss so much doing the tour yourself. Fantastic structure, wonderful adecdotes from our guide - just a really special place to visit.

Westminster Abbey left a lasting impression on me - memories of a lifetime!. When I visited Westminster Abbey I had a rudimentary knowledge of history and some famous historical figures. I never knew what it would really feel like to step over Sir Issac Newtons Grave, but I know now. I had imagined what the king's coronation chair looked like, but was I surprised, and wrong! I had not a clue about the damage done to this and other historical buildings during war bombings. But one afternoon in this beautiful Abbey and I was left with lasting impressions and memories for a lifetime. I literally stepped over Sir Issac Newton's grave, which was in the floor inside the abbey. At first I was in disbelief, and thought it rather improper to step across it, but it was part of the floor. Realizing everyone else was walking on it, I felt a great desire surge inside and I did step across the grave of the man who brought such change and insight to our lives. I won't give away the story of the coronation chair as I think it is better learned in person. The abbey is beautiful, old, royal and like none other . I would return to Westminster Abbey in a moment if I were able, and I hope someday to take my daughter there. It is full of educational opportunities, history and 'awe' for anyone. I recommend to everyone a visit to Westminster Abbey. It is worth the time and cost tenfold.

Truly interesting and amazing Abbey. This Abbey is full of history and is definitely not to be missed whilst visiting London. We purchased our passes on line through London Pass. They also have a audio tour.

A must see in London. This is a must see in London, and using the London Pass made it free to get in. Sure you have to pay for the London Pass but it's pays itself off in the end. Very historical and beautiful. Incredible sites and historical burial of people like Sir Isaac Newton, Winston Churchill and royalty. My wife and I enjoyed the stop. The audio tour guide is very helpful.
Simply incredible. Everything in this place is amazing. The tombs, the ceilings, the statues: an awe inspiring visit, I suggest it to everyone.

Spectacular but too expensive. Thoroughly enjoyed walking through the abbey. The audio tour was great and the staff and clergy were so helpful and willing to spend time answering the million questions my 9 year old had. You need to leave a good 3 hours if you want to do this justice we came later in the day and although they did not rush us out we were conscious that we needed to keep moving and as such missed taking in all the later parts of the tour. The only down side was the cost £40 for two adults and a child seemed a bit steep, but still glad we came.

Buy Your Tickets Online to Avoid the Wait. Visited Westminster Abbey in July and so glad that I bought our tickets online. The lines were crazy long well before it opened but we were able to enter in the first group of people due to our advance ticket purchase. This gave us a great headstart to enjoy the walk through Westminster Abbey without the crowds.

Great Britain's historical archive. Brilliant morning spent wondering around the Abbey. It's incredibly busy, packed full of tourists and the route is a bit awkward. However there is so much to take in, amazing to be see the resting place of so many historical figures. A must see for anybody visiting Westminster.

Amazing structure and architecture.. Have seen this before and the only disappointment was that the museum is closed until 2018. The Abbey also did not open until 9:30. They need to update the website to reflect these changes. The Abbey is beautiful and worth the visit but the museum is also a huge part of the story. Definitely take use of the free audio guide.
A must-do visit when in London. Great place to visit if you enjoy history. It gets a bit crowded at certain times, but one can use the audio guide to obtain all the input as you go round.

Beautiful historic building but expensive visit for family. I visited it about 20 years ago but we visited it again as my goddaughter who is living abroad wanted to see it. It was one of her choice of "places to see" during her stay in UK. We paid £54 (1 adult, 1 over 60, 1 student) which is not cheap despite I know that keeping running such building must be expensive, and waited in a slowly moving row for about 45 mins. Inside we got audio tour guide which was excellent, very clear and understandable. But due to HUGE amount of visitors you don't have feeling of fully enjoying the place. It's incredibly interesting, every corner, every place is connected with the history, sometimes I felt like "pushed" going forward with the crowd. I think it would be better to sell certain amount of tickets for certain hours ( also online which you cannot do now) that everybody could enjoy visit here.
Stunning!. We have been to London 5 times and visited here 3. I really enjoy all the history and seeing Newton's crypt.
Tour. What a gorgeous place! So much rich history!!! I thought it was a little pricey to get in but once I was in well worth the $$. I was in awe of the history and beautiful surroundings!

uplifting and awe inspiring. well worth the entry fee (£20 i think) and the audio guide is excellent and really helpful. there is so much history to see in this building it really is a must for any visitor to London. the cafe/restaurant is one of the best I've ever experienced in an historical building - blenheim palace could learn a lot!!!east to spend a couple of hours taking in all of the history here.

Stunning!. There are really not enough superlatives to describe this amazing building. Architecture, stained glass, history, famous tombs and memorials etc., Westminster Abbey has it all in abundance. Two other things that made this an even more memorable visit were that visitors are invited to join in a short service if they so wish. Also the numerous staff/wardens located around the building who were friendly and approachable, very knowledgable and obviously enthusiastic about the building.Although my husband and I were there for about 2 hours and saw so many amazing things when we read the book we brought home with us we realised how many other bits we had missed. So a return visit will definitely be needed.For visitors to London this has to be a 'must do'!

Evensong!. We were unsure if we **really** wanted to stand in line (no pre-ticketing or reservations available) to hear the choir sing at Evensong at Westminster. The wait was well worth it. Early birds in line for this service (which is not a full mass but prayer highlighted by much choir singing) have a great advantage: only a few (on our evening, less than 20) get admitted to the quire, which is the tiered bench seating facing either side of the aisle, and is where the choir sits.
