Informative . Very nice and informative trip. Needs about 2 hours. Can wall to big Ben from here and parliament is also walking distance. Also, can walk down to the supreme court where entry is free .

Something that should have been on my bucket list, and I didn't realize it till I went.. Westminster was just gorgeous, especially to a Kansan who grew up in a very small church! And the acoustics were sensational. We managed to get there as a service was starting, and the choir was excellent. The folks at Westminster were extremely courteous, and guided every visitor to a seat. We listened to a great message and a great choir in a spectacular setting.

Very historical. Naturally, there were a to of people there, and the line to get it was pretty long, but don't let that deter you! It's definitely worth it. You get an audio guide with your ticket that gives you all sorts of info as you walk through. The church is absolutely gorgeous and there's something to see everywhere. High recommend.
Happened by and.... We managed to jump in line right before the Abbey opened so the wait was short. Gorgeous building, great information on the history, classic Britain. Don't miss it!

OUR 2ND VISIT.... but it was not at all boring. Heard a lot of new information, and areas we had not seen the first time. Our 1st visit we did on our own - rented a video tour. That was interesting and we learned a lot. This visit was with a Blue Badge guide. Would recommend this approach to seeing the Abbey. Having the option to ask for further information and to visit some off the beaten path objects is really rewarding. And the beaten path is really beaten by hundreds of people all trying to see the same thing at the same time.
a must see for history. Westminster Abbey is the final resting place of British Royalty, great artists and writers, and great statesmen. If you like history, don't miss it.
Beautiful. Such a beautiful Church! Im a huge fan of the royals and the building itself is gorgeous unfortunaly it wasnt open to the pulblic but a walk around the grounds is lovely

Awesome. The Abbey itself is fantastic in terms of history and architecture (lady Chapel ceiling).
To state the obvious, the entry fee is over the top. I can categorically say I have never paid such a high fee to get into any self guided attraction.
Westminster Abbey management, don't bother copy and pasting your generic response to such reviews as mine.

Beautiful Abbey. It was with joy that I once more walked into this timepiece. What a glorious place to visit, to see outside and inside and to experience the stunning organ recital one evening. Absolutely amazing experience!

expensive but try the Coffee shop. Very expensive to visit a Abbey, and we arrive there was a events in the morning so were not allow in the Abbey until 13 hrs,. But you have to try the Cafe of the Abbey, the scone and tea are very good and you don't have to go in the Abbey to to go to the Café, just follow the sign.

You cannot miss this historical place!. There are several ways to visit the Abbey. The free 'local' way is to wait at the gate for Evensong (check the board for times of the services) and enter the Abbey for a choral prayer service. You are then able to see part of the church for free and enjoy the music as well.This visit we paid. We joined London Walks which collected our entry fee in advance and we entered without queuing with our private guide. We were then treated to an informative tour around the Abbey lasting about 2 hours or so.The most interesting part - for me - is the Henry VII chapel which is where some of the kings and queens of England are buried. It is the chapel of the Order of the Bath and the flags of the Knights are flying above their stalls. Also, the tomb for Henry VII and his queen, Elizabeth of York, designed by Torregiano is referred to as ushering the Renaissance into Britain. A pivotal work of sculpture and art.The Abbey houses many other important realia of English history; the Coronation Throne, the Shrine of St Edward the Confessor, and tombs of important figures such as Winston Churchill, Mary, Queen of Scots, the Unknown Warrior, Geoffrey Chaucer and the like.

Magnificent. The abbey is currently having its front refurbished, and to enter is quite expensive. However, if you visit on a Sunday, and use the back door, you have free access to quite a bit of the abbey, and it is well worth a visit.
Go early avoid the line. My cousin and I lined up at open and were he first through the doors. Great history and a good audio tour. Newton's tomb is worth it alone.

Incredible history and tombs!. Having seen Westminster Abbey on TV, I knew it would be pretty amazing - but actually walking through the buildings left me breathless and very moved. I downloaded the audio app on my iPhone before I arrived - and that was pretty great! I was overwhelmed with the tombs and memorials. At one point, I was towards the altar and turned back to take it all in - and the sunlight pouring through the stain glass windows literally took my breathe away. I also really enjoyed walking in the gardens and around the various courtyards. Take time to visit the museum as the history is rich and vibrant as well.
Church of History. You believe the beauty of the church and all the history associated with it. This is a must stop in London. Getting there is easy via the tubes (metro).

Amazing. I thought I would like St. Paul's more, but it was not the case. There is something about this church. With the London Pass, we toured around by ourselves...it's all very organized, but I was kicking myself for not getting a vicar led tour. I overheard one and the lady vicar was so jolly and entertaining and informative. So take one if you can and it was only 3 more pounds each with a L.P. ticket holder. We went around briskly and stayed about an hour, but you could easily stay for 2-3 hours. It was very interesting.We also went for an evensong. Here you could come and go as you please. At St. Paul's, you had a seat and stayed there until the evensong was finished and it felt like a long time to sit...maybe 45 minutes to an hour. Both evensongs were lovely.

Amazing experience. The church itself is beautiful and the history inside of it only adds to the phemoninal experience. So many Kings and Queens are buried here. Charles Darwin is buried here. They have a poets corner, which was my favorite part of the whole tour, filled with all of the greats (Dickens, Chaucer, Browning, Tennyson, etc etc.). It was amazing.

AKA Westminister Abbey London Eye!. Visited both from Sep 2009-Dec 2009, here lies one of the most renowned attraction sights in England and in Europe in All! All of the main complex of attractions are together here: Westminister Abbey, London Eye, Big Ben, and the Thames River. You can take a grandiose view there and see as many attraction sights as you want! Certainly one of the most well-known places.

The history at Westminster Abbey is surreal.. The beauty and history of this one place is just amazing. Be for warned if you go especially in the summer months it is crowded with tour groups, school groups and teams of tourists but even still it cannot take away the feeling of standing in the shadows of such interesting, happy, sad history. A must when visiting.
Great.. Buy your tickets ahead of time and avoid the long lines. Use the audio aid. It is great and gives a lot of information. Great visit.
Soul experience. Organised and very enlightening. Free voice guide makes the experience even better. This experience will speak to your soul.
Famous buried here. Go and see the marvelous old cathedral and its numerous burial plots of kings, nobles and the famous. Go and soak in all the history that lies here.

Beautiful. We went on a Sunday and of course it is closed for service so we were back at 9.30am the next day. The lines looked long but moved very quickly. Make sure you get in the right que as they have one for the London pass and one for tickets and groups etc. when inside you get a little radio piece to tell you about all the highlights. It's very beautiful inside but also very interesting to read about all the past kings and people who are buried there.

Just beautiful.. We visited the Abbey on a sunny day in May, and although the line for entry appeared very long and a bit daunting, it moved along quickly. The abbey itself is glorious, with so much history. One of the guides came along and gave us a bit of a history lesson and he obviously loved his job, and you could tell. Would highly recommend for anybody to go and see if they are visiting London.

Really interesting. Must visit this place if you are in London. You cannot miss it because is part of the british history. Really nice to spend a lot of time around and take pictures. I love this place during the sunset because you can take really nice pic from the opposite side of the river.
History hits you right between the eyes. My third time, but never gets old. Just walking around makes you realize the past, present and future all in one building.
As I expected - magnificent. We attended Evensong....wonderful! The boys choir was amazing. The layout lends to a very different experience.
So stunning. What needs to be said? Just an amazing place steeped in history. Not to be missed, despite the price. Be forewarned, no photos are allowed, so you might want to leave the camera at home.

go for the christmas service. Tickets for the christmas services become available in November. They're free, and first come first serve. It's a lovely service, full of lovely ceremonies. The setting is great - it's nice to see it in use, rather than as a tourist attraction.

Beautiful old church with mega history. Its expensive to visit, but a must see. Many kings and queens buried inside as well as Isaac Newton and others. I nice place to visit and say that you walked in the same place as British Royalty.

London must see.. One thousand years of the best of Britain's history, people and religion. This incredible abbey is breathtaking to experience, allowing all to pay homage to giants of history buried there, enjoy art & architecture or to reflect and pray as countless people have done for the past millennium. An architectural wonder this ancient place of worship in the heart of Westminster caters to every traveller, tourist or pilgrim. Once the meeting place of the English government, it is filled with beautiful architecture, stunning stained glass windows, monolithic sculpted tombs and memorials to some of the most important people in history. From Elizabeth the First of England to Charles Dickens, Sir Issac Newton to Charles Darwin etc.The place where the British monarchs have been crowned, buried and celebrated is a must see for anyone coming to London.I advise looking at website before you visit - often closed to tourists for religious services and memorials; the opening hours are varied and few compared to other popular London attractions.Go early as there are often massive queues of tourists waiting to enter and it really is much more special when it is quiet and there are fewer people. If you are entering as a tourist you must pay and admission charge - I think it was around £15 for an adult which I think is very expensive. There is an audio guide included in price and it is very detailed explaining many facets of history, art, contents and religion. (The staff are very friendly, knowledgeable and happy to talk & help) The audio guide takes you on a tour of the abbey its chapels and cloisters. If you are there to worship entry is free but Id avoid busy times as being so popular it can be very full with tourists and school groups from around the world. Despite the very expensive entrance fee, it is so worth the cost! Whatever interested you have from history, art, the monarchy etc the grandeur and majesty of this jewels in Londons crown is so worth a visit. (On a side note - to help spread the cost as a tourist in London - i recommend entering the abbey with the London Pass - available for tourists from one to several days - this card provieds access to abbey as well as many other incredible London landmarks - which when visiting a few or many can become quite expensive after the travel costs admission fees are added up.)

Great sight. Stayed very close to the Abbey visited it once, buy walked by it many times. Great photo opportunity just about every time you see it. Very old (1300's) and saturated with history. The tombs, the architecture are amazing
School church . This was the church we went to for school services! Did not appreciate it at the time but wow what an impressive place. Go go go

overpriced. 20 pound to enter no photography aloud for apart from the tomb of the unknown soldier is a very crowded and tacky place ,very disapointed from a Englishmens point of view ,no wonder there was a reformation.

Must See. Summertime...long lines, but once you are inside a beautiful 'museum' of history. We did not do the audio and chose to walk around our selves. Saw so many crypts, memorials. Would have liked to take pictures.

Historically inviting, but try St Pauls. Its worth it for the history, its usually pretty busy and its lay out is a lot of smaller rooms that seem to get very crowded, its frustrating. I would recommend St Pauls over Westminster every time!

A worthwhile visit. We were lucky to visit when the queues were short. The audio guide included in the admission price made the visit so much more interesting than trying to see the abbey without. The architecture is wonderful both inside and out. There is so much history here.

Beutiful setting. A little pricey but if you have an interest in history well worth the visit . If you want to get there for free just tell them you want to pray and they will allow you access to a small area where you will still get the atmosphere

Expensive but beautiful and interesting. Westminster Abbey is stunningly beautiful and should be experienced. It is worth the price of admission which is not cheap (can't remember what I paid though). Expect to join crowds in summer. Don't rush it. It is best experienced slowly to take in the atmosphere. Attending a service there, which I did years ago, is well, well worth the effort.

Westminster abby. I never get fed up visiting this place , steeped in history , royal weddings , no less Kate and William , the coronation chair , th actually see and the 800/900 plus years of history , as you walk around the coolness of the Abby ,the calm , so so many historic things to look at , in awe of the builders who managed to construct such a place , medival carvings , elation , respect , feeding ones knowledge to walk in the steps of royalty . Yes yes yes highly recommend .
Awestruck. Wish we could have taken photos. So much history here. Plan a whole day. We probably did not need the audio tape to listen to.

Beautiful Church! The Site of Kate and William's Wedding!!. Since we were in London, I had to show my daughter the site of Kate and William's wedding, especially since she'd watched it on television. We were unable to tour the facility, but the we were able to see the splendor of the building from outside. If you have time, try to tour the inside, as I heard it is extremely beautiful.
Once in a lifetime opportunity.. The inside of this religious historical building is amazing. The burials and the detail is unforgettable.
WOW!. An amazing place that helped me to understand the depth and breath of British history. I felt as if I was in a time capsule that spanned many hundreds of years!

History surrounds you!. I visited with my husband and two daughters and was not disappointed! Most teenagers usually dislike cathedrals and museums but they were very well entertained at the Abbey. There is a scavenger hunt for children (probably best for younger children) and they had fun competing with each other to find things first. I had just finished reading the Da Vinci code so the history of Westminster Abbey was still fresh in my mind. It was wonderful to imagine all the historical events that had taken place there centuries earlier. A must see for history buffs!

awe inspiring. this exhibition was truly memorable.To see where famous kings and queens and other outstanding people in history are buried was remarkable.Also where royal families have been married .Truly a piece of history not to be missed
Brilliant. Amazing, to visit such an important building in the history of England. To walk past the tombs of so many Kings and Queens, awesome, just loved it, a definite must.

Beautiful place and rich history. We decided to go to Westmister Abbey without buying tickets beforehand. Even though the line was huge, we only spent 20 minutes in line. The audio guide is included with the entrance fee which is a plus. You get to see everything at your own pace but no pictures allowed which was a bummer. it is a beautiful place and pictures in the TV does not do it justice.

historical GIANT. The abbey was amazing. The history, the artwork, sculptures, the people entombed there - amazing. A must see. We took a guided tour which was helpful. I recommend reading about the abbey prior to getting there or having a guide. There are hundreds of years of history in the place - you just cannot appreciate it all in an hour or two.

Simply stunning. The Abbey is worth the line to get in. It is a beautiful church with so many amazing side rooms and memorials. They have a free audio tour which is easy to navigate and adds to the experience. I was disappointed that pictures were not allowed.
Graveyard, not church.. Amazing indoor graveyard. Loved seeing the plots of famous figures you read about in history books. loved it
The abbey. i had been a long time ago, but going back was a great experience. There is a church service every day at 12.30, which is worth attending.

Go to the 5 PM Evensong Service. Westminster Abbey is visually stunning, though it is a bit overcrowded with tombs! They literally seem stacked on top of each other. The 5 PM Evensong service lasts about 45 minutes and gives you a chance to experience the Abbey as it was meant. The small choir is excellent - young boys through adults - and just like you may have seen on TV. This is a really good way to end a busy day exploring London between Buckingham Palace and the Parliament Buildings. Go for the Abbey, but stay for the Evensong! Tip: get there around 4:30, as line can be long to get in.

Another Must See. Spectacular and great to see the famous names that are buried here as you go around. Does get very busy and crowded. The architecture is outstanding and you get a real sense of history as you enter.

The Evensong Service. We visited Westminster on a Sunday and the tours are closed, however we caught the 3 pm service after waiting in a short line. It was a wonderful service, mostly in song with the boys choir and adult men. Gorgeous and inspiring music and litany and the scenery was outstanding! About an hour for the service in total.

Good but....... Stunning but there is something that seems wrong about having to pay to visit a church . Beautiful building from the outside , lots of history on the inside . Probably not great for teens .
Westminster Abbey. This is also a must see/visit if you want to experience some history. We also had the opportunity to experience the choir and to sit with the choir area.
Amazing. Felt very humble after we had finished looking around, and it made me realize how important history is to our culture.

Absolutely awesome!. As an English major in college, it's on your to do list to visit Westminster Abbey to see Poet's corner alone. Everything else was a freaking bonus and a half!Westminster was absolutely stunning both inside and out. There was so much history to take in. When you arrive, you pay inside or present your London Pass (I had a London Pass) and get started on your tour. If you have the London Pass, you get a free audio guide (looks like an old school cell phone that you hang around your neck and put up to your ear). The abbey is setup with a clear path around the whole building so you get the full experience. Things to note: make sure you look for the numbers indicating when you should move on through your audio guide. There's an area where you can light a candle and leave a prayer that they will say out loud at the designated times. Bring your own pen! There are times throughout the day where they ask everyone to join them in prayer and it's beautiful to see a whole slew of people, stop, bow their heads in silence. There are other times throughout the day where they do special ceremonies but it is a working abbey so you will see clergy cleaning, setting up, etc., which is also cool. Of course, the historical significance is amazing. So much to learn, to see, to do.Things to note:1) Make sure to pay attention to the numbers and your audio guide, it can be a bit confusing.2) When they say an area is tight, they mean it. Be careful if you're claustrophobic.3) If you have issues with stairs, be careful, a lot of the stairs are uneven. It's old!4) Do not take pictures. There are signs everywhere asking people not to do so for a reason - it ruins the artwork.5) After Poet's corner, there is an area with a lot of seating for services, etc., in case you need a break.6) Plan for plenty of time, trust me! You'll want it!

Not to miss. The 20 GBP ticket price may seem high, but it comes with a free audio tour, and I ended up spending well over an hour here - checking out the gardens and chapels, etc. Well worth the visit. Fascinating architecture and history.

Awesome!. As we were in London on a Sunday we went to one of the Church Services at the Abbey which was preceded by a free Organ Recital. There was a queue, however, we entered the Abbey in plenty of time for the recital and also the service which was inspirational and thought provoking, and in line with scripture (which is a blessing in this day and age!) To sit in the Abbey and soak up the atmosphere of worshipping in such a magnificent building is truly something else.There is no charge for attending the service, however, there is a 'retiring offering' when leaving the service, with the money raised going to mission support groups.

How much history can one place hold!?. The Abbey is made famous and usually known just for the royal weddings...how tiny a spectre that is, how so much more there is about this history treasure house. Not only is this a spectacularly well carved and sculpted piece of architect both inside and out there is so much that the audio tapes teach you. Amazing! Think all the Royal lineage, think poets and writers of English verse, think innovators and geniuses, think real history. Yes it can get crowdd- obviously , but you can also stay for services which are splendid, the quality of the music is infinitesimally exquisite. A beautiful experience.

Nice views. Good for a view from outside and its a must London photo-op place, especially from the Thames side. You might think of skipping the tour inside if you are tight on schedule as its a bit pricey and queues are long.
As expected. Really awesome, covered on the Original Bus Tour that cost me like £20 for covering the entire London as a tourist.

Not your average church. I was expecting and elaborate church (which it was), however it was so much more. The audio guide directed me around the indoor cemetery, of well know people. The staff were on hand to help out and provide valuable information.

Take the tour!. Has to be a must visit whilst in London. So much history. Be prepared to take you time and definitely take the guided tour. Then headphones are OK, but a personal guide is so much better. Try to avoid the crowds if at all possible.

A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!. The architecture and the sculptures are fabulous and to realize it's been standing there since 960 AD, is mind-blowing. There is so much to see and so much history inside that it will take you several hours to really see the entire Abbey. This is another location where you cannot take photos inside. There are kings and queens and poets and politicians of every kind buried here in magnificent fashion. Coronations and other important events take place here, as well. The last thing you see before leaving is the coronation chair which has been in use for several centuries. Very cool, indeed!
Wonderful and Historic. Great history and architecture. Very large and a lot to see. Would recommend a tour guide or at least a good book.
gorgeous. The audio helps a lot. It was pretty crowded, but there was still space. Place is huge. No line while we were there.

Mmm... Not sure if it's worth the money and the time.. It's an astonishing abbey... but I'm not sure if I would queue again to visit it, especially with a teenager. I think its charm is more related to its history than to its uniqueness. Do your own math...

Favorite Site in London!. London is an awesome city with so many treasures. My favorite by far is Westminster Abbey. Not because it's a beautiful cathedral, but because of all the history and relics inside. You could spend a full day if you truly wanted exploring the many treasures.

Much to see. There are a lot of interesting things to see, art, history, stained glass. It is a very historic place, looks to be in restoration. We did not have a formal tour we just leisurely looked around.
Worth a visit. In London for meetings and decided to pay the Abbey a visit stunning beautiful amazing.all the years I just walked by .we don't appreciate our own history at times.

Beautiful, Historical. This is a great part of the London Pass, so essentially free. The church is quite large so expect to spend at least an hour touring. Audio guides were free and very detailed. They really help explain what you're seeing (various tombs and architecture) as there aren't many signs to explain. No photography allowed, but that's ok - you can just focus on what you're seeing. Prepare for scaffolding, it's old and in constant upkeep and repair. Staff are very kind and helpful.

Crowded, ill-organized. Visited the Abbey for the first time 20 years ago and was impressed - then! Now we've visited many similar venues in France, Italy and Spain and Westminster is rather nondescript. Of course it's part of our heritage and redolent with familiar history, literary allusions and royal ghosts! So it's almost a "required" visit. But it could use time-controlled entry slots, some notion of a "route" past the highlights instead of the current "free-for-all", better demarcation of the downright dangerously uneven floor. Obviously it's a national treasure and still a place of worship but its presentation needs a facelift.

Not impressed. Definitely not impressed, especially by the amount charged to get in. I'd recommend bypassing Westminster and visiting its neighbor to the left (as you are walking up). Delightful yet smaller... and free. (please give donations)

Underrated attraction! Go and see for yourself!. The building is large and FULL of history! The tour necklace is the way to go! Jeremy Irons was the tour guide on the soundtrack which is SUPER COOL! This is a great attraction!
Excellent audioguides. Audioguides were excellent and included in the entrance fee. Queue for tickets was long but moved quickly and efficiently. Staff very helpful.

Amazing architecture, beauty and history.. Well worth the visit. The kids were even in awe over the amount of history laying in one place. Thoroughly enjoyed the visit and did not think it was overpriced to enter. We visited on a day that was fairly crowded but were still able to spend time in each area of the abbey.
Historic. This is truly a historic site and a must see. Photos are limited within the site so if your going to take any you must be creative cause there are cameras watching. Enjoy!

Art work. People all throughout history have built beautiful temples to worship the Lord, and this is another example. The craftsmanship in this church is incredible, it was built to receive kings and queens. This thing that one can't take pictures is a little weird.If you go check for the mass times and you may have a little extra time attending mass at Westminter Abbey (if you are a catholic). Even if you are not a catholic listening to a message of peace and love doesn't hurt. It is a little too expensive to get in, fees are expensive in London. Shakespeare, Darwin and others were buried in this holy place.
History revisited. Try brass rubbings in the lower level and walk through the Abbey to visit the tombs of historical figures. The building and glass in the windows are well worth the trip!
Mesmorized. Plan on spending at least 4 hours here, the tombs are so interesting. No tour guide is necessary. Kids love to walk on only the black squares, or the white ones. LOL

Brilliant history but expensive. It is always worth a look around Westminster Abbey - there is so much to see that you always learn something - but this time I found it to be more like a tourist attraction than a church.First of all had to queue to pay (and was unable to gift aid the fee like many other Cathedrals), and felt that the adult entrance fee of £20 was a bit steep, even for London. The roped areas led everybody on the same path around the Abbey, and it was disappointing that photography was prohibited - even without flash. Most visitors were listening to the audio guides, thus inadvertently blocking the way to others.To be honest, I found the hordes to be a bit overwhelming, and passed through quite quickly. The one place I wanted to see was the Chapter House, but it is not open to visitors.Have given a rating of four for the history, but really was a bit disappointed this time.
This is not to be missed!. Steeped in history, this is simply a fascinating and beautiful place to visit. Well worth the price of admission.
Sunday Service. Our family of four attended Sunday morning services. A great experience in a beautiful place. After the service we spent a few moments in the cloisters before continuing our day.

Quintessential England - Westminster Abbey. In all my trips to London over the years I have avoided Westminster Abbey as it's always been so busy This year I was in London in mid January and there were no queues. I can't believe what I have missed all these years. It is the most amazing place. If you have any interest at all in English history this is an absolute must. To see the multitude of monuments, tombs and memorials to the greatest of British people is just overwhelming. I could have spent the entire day there, 5 hours was just not enough time. The audio guide is very good although it doesn't cover everything (how could it?). The various officials standing around are very helpful and knowledgeable if you have any questions. There is a wonderful little book in the bookshop called 'Who's Buried Where?' that would have been very helpful had I bought it when I went in rather than when I left. I would have liked to have found some of the more obscure tombs.Of course the atmosphere, the windows, the building itself are all extraordinary. It is still a working abbey so services are conducted there.It's a must - allow at least a morning or afternoon. You won't be disappointed.

Westminster Abbey. Packed with history Westminster Abbey is a great place to visit. Once inside you will discover the Grave of the Unknown Warrier, as well as Poets' Cormer. This was my first visit and it was well worth it!

Stunning. Westminster Abbey is a beautiful cathedral, when you go in you immediately feel historical, there are lots of tombs from the Wars, including the Unknown Soldier, it has been the sight of many royal weddings and funerals, the only gripe I would have is the entrance fee which is a bit steep, but I guess worth the money when you can spend a great deal of time in there, guided tours are available and I would recommned.

Very Pretty!. You do have to pay to get in but if you're going to worship then entry is free at certain times. Check the website to be sure. A private tour is relatively cheap and its worth it to learn about the church and the Royal Family too.

Consider 5pm mass!. We arrived at Westminster too late to take a tour, but just in time for the 5pm mass.We are Catholic so we decided to attend the one hour mass. So glad we did! The sound of the Choir in the Abbey will stay with me for a very long time, simply unforgettable. It was also a very special opportunity to spend time with my brothers and sisters from all over the globe in this Holy and Historical Place.

I liked the church, I loved the service. We toured Westminster and the amount of workmanship that must have gone in all of the sculptures is truly incomprehensible to me. I admired the memorials, but honestly, that is not my favorite thing.Their evensong service was so beautiful. If you are planning a trip to London, I suggest you make time to attend the service. It is at 5:00 p.m., but you will have to be there earlier.We were fortunate enough to be in the main section and our seats were against the wall. We sat in beautifully carved wooden structures that were really tall. Some of the choir literally sat right in front of me...I could reach out and touch a couple.The songs and the service were beautiful. I could have sat there much longer. It was very peaceful. I visited four countries on my trip and this is the one stop that really stays with me.
Impressive but too crowded. Impressive history and architecture but overcrowded. I do not understand not being able to take pictures in a church.

Enjoyed a mass with beautiful choir. I was planning to walk through but it was past visiting hours and it turned out there was a mass which I had the privilege of attending. The music was beautiful and of course the setting with stained glass and artifacts was stunning.

too crowded. First you need to stand in line to get there and then wobble around in a crowd. The toilets did not work due to construction. I understand it could be a better experience if to really dig into the history and make a little of an advance homework. 5 stars for architecture and inner works.

Great Guides. Our choir traveled here with a sight impaired person. The guide, seeing her white cane, invited her to actually feel some of the things with his guidance so she could experience some of the beauty. All I could think was, "what a classy guy to go out of his way for her". Kudos to the staff!!
Where the UK nation get unified. A must to visit, the tomb discribed the history of UK from 11 th century to today. A good way to explain to the kids the UK history

Westminster Abbey. If I could give 10 points I would. This church is stunning. The Gothic architecture is among the best in the world. Where else are you going to find such a lot of royals? It really is impossible to pick one bit is better than the other. Two things you might like to take into consideration. When I last went it was £10. It can also get very busy

A Must to See. The history and workmanship of the abbey is unbelievable. The statues and crypts of deceased persons and royalty is very educational and not the least bit boring. A must to see for any visitor.

The Abbey.. THE BEAUTY unbelievable... Of course one must visit the Westminster Abbey when in LONDON. Disappointed I couldn't take pictures.. BUT CERTAINLY UNDERSTAND. Most of us have witnessed on T.V. one of the great events that take place in the Abbey..but being there & seeing is amazing.

Stunningly beautiful, so much history!. I spent 3 hours here, and could easily have spent longer. We went at about 11, and the line was manageable. I wished we could have taken one of the verger tours, because it sounded like that added a lot to the experience, but we didn't want to wait for the next one, which started at 2. There is no set schedule for the verger tours, so you just have to see if one is available at the time you are there. The audio guide that comes with the regular tour is very good though. The only disappointing thing is that you cannot take pictures inside.

Is another church.. We took a stroll there from the Big Ben, about 15 minutes walk from Westminister Station. Unless you have a guide to know why is it so special, otherwise this is just another Gothic church.

Well worth a visit. We went to a short service and were blown away by the music - from Handel's Messiah, beautifully performed. The inside is beautiful and so interesting; there is no entrance on a Sunday except for a service, no tours so we couldn't look round the whole of the Abbey, but were fascinated by the parts we were able to see.

Enjoyable mass even for the non-religious tourist. Free entry if you go to mass at 5:00, can hear the choir sing but we couldn't see them from our viewpoint. And they do kind of shoo you out after mass. We enjoyed it.

amazing experience. I was the last one to enter the abbey as it was closing time and it was an experience of a lifetime! They dont allow luggage to be pulled inside so I had to pick up my heavy suitcase and carry it along. There are headphones inside which guide you through the abbey. It was so overwhelming to experience the characters come alive who I had only read about in history books- Newton, Shakespeare, Wordsworth, etc etc alongwith the queens and kings. It takes about 2-3 hours for seeing the abbey though I could spend the whole day there! Its definitly worth a visit for anyone who values history

Stand in awe; it's great architecture. We skipped the formal tour and got a tip from Fat Tire Bike Tour London: Go to the 5 p.m. "service" and hear the boys choir for free. No photos allowed inside. Be quiet; it's a 30-minute service.

Awesome. The line snaked down the path and around the corner, but the wait was well worth it. While you wait take lots of photos of the exterior, count the gargoyles for fun. The interior is huge and beautiful. So much to see. The history is so interesting. I especially loved the Chapel where the royal weddings are held. Even the ancient floor tiles are beautiful. Take one of the recorded self tours, you will gain so much more from this, than if you go and just wander through the building. Definitely 10/10

History Abounds. There is great sense of English history about the Abbey - burial place of royalty, writers, poets and all. The architecture really caught my eye too. As Brit, this was my first ever visit inside the Abbey, which I'd passed frequently over the years without really knowing what lay behind the exterior (well I'd seen some pictures and films of royal weddings and coronations and other ceremonies ....but being there is something else.
Beautiful - go early in the day!. The abbey is beautiful. It gets really busy, so if you can go early in the day, do it. The guides are very helpful and knowledgeable.

Imagine yourself a wonderful scholarly education in this beautiful place. What a building. Go early in the morning and do a tour. Theres so much history to take in. Wonder throughout the back streets and see the gently village feel for the students to enjoy.

Stunning Abbey. The history to this building is huge, seeing is believing, you need to spend a few hours in the Abbey to get the best of it. I just love to visit and when we get to London we always try to see the Abbey. Well worth a visit, on the ground, plenty of people visit the Abbey so try and get there early.
A real sense of history. Very good audio tour to listen to and improve your history of GB. Interesting tombs to see and some amazing architecture. Worth a visit without doubt.

Good but crowded. Obviously a ton of history here, so it is a classic place to visit. That said it was very crowded when we visited, so be prepared for that. The congestion inside definitely detracted from our visit. We downloaded the app for our mobile devices and brought our ear buds with us which made the time spent more enjoyable. However, if you are crowd averse and are going to be in York, I would strongly consider visiting York Minster instead, especially if you're pressed for time.

Opulent. What can be said about this old Abbey that has not been said before. It is beautiful and worth seeing but it is hard to believe anyone ever actually lived and worked there. Certainly a great place to visit and learn

Fabulous. Sometimes you visit a famous sight you have heard about your whole life, and upon seeing it, your reaction is "That's it? I expected more." Westminster Abbey delivers everything you expect and so much more, it is amazing, and the history surrounding it and the people are amazing. It is a Must See for a London visitor.

Very interesting cathedral - lots of history here. Definitely worth a visit - lots of interesting aspects to view. Can be crowded so be prepared to wait some time. The entry fee is on the expensive side - especially for a church but you're in London so no doubt this is an expensive town.

"Indescribable". We have visited this wonderful place many many times.... on our own as well as with friends & family visiting London.
This is a must see for London... The history and grandeur are beyond belief...
A museum, a spiritual place...
A must see. Very impressive building and excellent self guided audio guide. Had the london pass so was able to avoid the long line. Would definitely recommend.

Just lovely. What a glorious place! I missed visiting last time I was in London & so am very happy I got here this time. It was £20 to enter as an adult. Free wifi - always a bonus. It was very crowded & some crowd control needed when going in and out if done if the smaller areas. But it is just so beautiful. No photography in Abbey, but fine in the Cloisters. A cute little museum also there.

History. Westminster Abbey is a beautiful abbey that is full of history. The line in was not long and once inside it is full of history with kings and queens buried here as well as writers, poets and scientists. A must see in London.

Enjoy an evening service at Westminster Abbey. We attended an evening service at Westminster Abbey. The acoustics were amazing. Check that day that the service will be offered. Sometimes private services may take place instead. Arrive early enough to get seating, because otherwise it can be uncomfortable. We had a mix-up about the schedule, ended up rushing to get there, and were in the back, standing room only. Music still sounded beautiful. We did this instead of an actual tour, as we saw that there was always a line outside for tours.
Gorgeous Abbey. Such old graves and memorials, gorgeous architecture, very interesting and worth the price of admission.

Listening from the Quire. Already reviewed under Westminster, we were lucky to get in line early and were seated in the quire area, where the choir members sang! Loved the Evensong service, which ran about an hour. They provide a service brochure that will help you stand and sit appropriately according to the Episcopalian rite. Once you are seated for the service, you may not leave - unless you get unceremoniously escorted out for being inappropriate! It is not a concert - it is a religious service and people are there to worship.
Enjoy a service. Loved visiting this famous place -- I especially loved when I visited on a Friday evening and was able to listen to a service with the organ music and choir! WOW
lots of history. The history that we learned here was very interesting and certainly worth your time. Even though there are lots of things to see here.

Burials and weddings. Kings are buried here, as are poets and writers. So too are royals married.
The abbey is a unique mix of Anglican and Britishness. Lots of history but also lots of pageantry and national pride.

Awesome!. Westminster Abbey was the highlight of my trip to London. London. It is so beautiful, so full of history. Just amazing; my favorite part was the Poet's Corner.. The grounds are lovely and it also has a very nice gift shop. It is rather pricey, but well worth it; I would love to go again. It would take two or three trips to really take it all in! Just awe-inspiring!
The Abbey. The history to see here is awesome. Across the street there is a court with several statues. And a good view of Big Ben as well.

Amazing architecture and famous names abound.. If you are an Anglophile, or a former Brit Lit teacher like myself, this is heaven on earth. Be sure to use your buy one get one rail pass coupons, and students with ID are a lower rate, too. We loved the Kings, queens, heroes, scientists and poet's corner.
Steeped in history. Well worth a visit. Well connected spot, as well. The audio guides make history come alive. Do not rush through the tour, its worth a half day trip

Beautiful. What a great church. We attended a church service there at 5:30. On most days there is a 5:30 pm service that is open to the public at no charge. The service lasted about 45 minutes and seated several hundred people. What a highlight of our London trip. We missed the daily tour and I wish we would have been able to see more of the Abbey.
A Must-See. Be prepared for long lines to get in, but well-worth the wait. Audio guides are extremely helpful in navigating and understanding what you are viewing.

Church service and holy communion. A couple of times a day you are able to attend church services and holy communion. WOW! As I sat humbly in the pew I knew I was in a place not only visited by hundreds of thousands of people, royal and peasant alike, but in the presence of God, of an almighty being, and the Lord Jesus Christ. WOW.... how humbling.

Walk through History at Westminster Abbey. This beautiful church is not only beautiful architecture but embodies a multitude of England's historical events. I have to admit the song was playing in my head.
Visiting Westminster Abbey. Beautiful and historically important, this is a not to be missed site. Not only is the building architecturally beautiful but many important figures are buried there.

A must while in London. Definitely get there early, because it gets crowded quickly. It was beautiful inside and out. The audio guide is very helpful, as it gives more information. So much history, it is like a history book of Britain.

Worship at Westminster Abbey. You would have to pay for a tour of Westminster Abbey!
We attended a worship service and were allowed to experience it in a most intimate setting! The choir singing was absolutely beautiful!

Awe inspiring. My daughter and I visited in June, purchased tickets online ahead of time to save a bit of money (recommended). Definitely take the audio tour - it helps to provide a context for this amazing place. Truly inspiring, we spent a good couple of hours there.

Amazing and historic abbey. The tour of Westminster Abbey is excellent. You are provided with a self-guided tour with headphones that you can travel at your own pace. The artifacts are amazing. Unfortunately, photography is not allowed in the Abbey.
The whole reason for the trip..... Westminster Abbey was everything and more we expected as it was the centerpiece and the reason for our trip. It is the can't miss of the visit.
You must do this in London. THe line was a bit long, the price a bit high, but if you come to London this is not to be missed. So much history and amazing architecture.

Great place, amazing architecture!. Definitely worth going to, worth the time and money. Next time I'd take audio guide to learn more about this place and go there for a couple of hours. Very special, and very important place for England. Everywhere you look is something to see and explore. Also, friendly staff who will answer (or at least try to) all your questions.
A must if you are visiting London. I didn't know so many famous people were honoured in this beautiful building. It is definitely a "oh my gosh" factor as you wander round this huge structure.
Perfect historical building. Well maintained old buildings but around there always huge crowd from all over the world. It's very worth to visit.
Great history and architecture. Definitely worth your time. Next time, I will take the audio tour to give me context to the history contained within Westminster Abbey

Special Place. Great Place to take a tour. The tomb of the unknown soldier is near the door, the tombs of famous poets, artists, kings and queens can be viewed. It is a good idea to get the audio guide as it provides more information than you would normally know.If you are visiting towards the end of the day, it is possible to attend Evensong. Check the signage. If it is a sung evensong it is truly worth the additional stay as the accoustics are great.Ocassionally there are recitals and I attended a nice organ concert in the Abbey. Check ahead for special events, the cost was quite nominal.

Perfection!. This site is tremendously important to England, and there's something to see—and learn about—everywhere you look. The audio guides are informative and easy to manage, and the staff are incredibly friendly and helpful. Of course, the Abbey itself is beautiful and historic, but I was particularly taken with the tombs of Elizabeth I and Mary Stuart, as well as Poet's Corner. We were also allowed admission to the College Gardens the day we visited and enjoyed seeing the flowers. The shop and museum are also must-sees. I always buy far too many books on tropics to places like this, but I can't help myself. Definitely worth the £20 admission fee.

Walking in the footsteps of giants. The place gets you - it is old, crumbly and dripping with history. Every stone tells a story. I particularly enjoyed looking up the memorial stones for the famous ones - Newton et al.
History in person. Fantastic piece of history. Seems like more of a graveyard than a church. Great place to see, though tough to take pictures as the guards are strict on no photography. Must visit.
Take the tour and skip the gift shop.. The Abbey is nothing less than spectacular however the tour queue was disorganized and the gift shop was small and cramped with very cranky salespeople.
Wonderful Tour. This is by far the best tour I have ever been on. You don't just look at history, you are part of it.
Expensive and queues. Really wanted to visit but £20 admission is high,and queue was half an hour in no shade on a v. Hot day,so did not bother

A must see for first time travelers to London!. My family and I really enjoyed touring Westminster Abbey. We spent a lot of time there with the audio guide and learned so much. My kids really enjoyed it, as well. It is really beautiful and there is so much history there. The only negative we had was when we stepped up to get our audio guides, the man that worked there asked, "Where are you from?" And when we said, "The US," he said "obviously" very rudely....not sure why, but the attitude was not necessary (older African American gentleman could use some training on manners). Anyway, if you are town Westminter Abbey is not to be missed.
Very nice. Great time visiting the abbey. Wish we could take pictures inside but it is not allowed. We had a London Pass, so we were able to fast track.

Like taking a time machine back through history. For anyone with an appreciation for history and architecture, this is a must-see. Give yourself at least an hour to complete the audio tour that highlights many of the significant tombs and monuments to a millennium's worth of kings, queens and other famous Britons.
Stunningly Beautiful!. A Must in London!! Absolutely beautiful inside and out. We bought tickets on site and the wait wasn't too long for entry. I highly recommend the inside views, as well.
A Must. This is the second time we have visited the Abbey. This time we had the time to do the full audio guided tour. The Abbey is so very interesting...the history, it is almost incomprehensible.
Simply grand and excellent. Great museum and galleries. Dont forget to watch the Queen's Diamond Jubilee Galleries. Try to visit early part of the day.

Great way to spend an afternoon!. There's not much else to say other than: WOW. I had high expectations for the abbey, considering I am both a history buff and love anything royal. Upon entering the abbey, each person is handed an audio tour companion; each part was long, but definitely informative. I was most excited to see the Poet's Corner, which is shown at the end of the visit. I also saw Sir Isaac Newton and Shakespeare's place as well. I believe the cost was 11 Pounds, but it was definitely worth the price -- I spent the afternoon constantly taken aback by just how GORGEOUS the abbey is today.

Immerse yourself in history. One of my favourite tourist spots in London...its so grand and impressive. Definitely make use of the audio tour to see and learn as much as possible. One of my favourite things is the memorials and burials (odd, I know)...but it brought history into the present for me. The last time I was there I had planned to attend service at the church but ended up being too unwell to go, but it is on my list of things to do when I return in September 2015.
Awesome. Had the opportunity to attend an evening service, what a thrill, awesome experience to see the historical buildingand listen to the beautiful voices. A once in a lifetime event.
Awe inspiring!. Awe inspiring! Though not a particularly religious person, still could not help but be touched by the architecture and history of this beautiful building.
Very unique and elegant!. This is very close to the other areas that I visited. So, I don't have to take too much effort to travel to it. It is elegant and marvelous. I like it very much.
Great audio guide. This place was amazing. one of the best audio guides i have ever used. The points were brief and to the point. the traffic moved well and i was never overwhelmed. A must see

Where History was Made. What was most amazing about Westminster Abbey is its place in history. As you walk through the building all your are reminded of the many historical events, housed within these walls. Built in the 10th century, the building is symbolic of England of both the past and present. I could vividly remember the funeral of Princess Diana within the Abbey. If you are able, I would highly recommend taking the tour. As with most sites, it really makes the significance of the building come alive. Just as impressive as the interior, the exterior is a site in itself. The architecture of Westminster Abbey leaves one speechless because of its soaring towers and intricate beauty. How exciting to walk where history was made!

Need More to Attract Tourists. Beside typical Colonial architecture, not much to see or do. Very busy neighborhood and extremely confusion for tourists to take in all the hustling, bustling around. Watch out for traffics on the opposite with the res to the world. Fast moving cars, buses, motorbikes can make you a road killed.

Buy tickets online. We bought tickets in advance online and I highly recommend this. Upon arrival we saw a long line to get in but there was a sign for a separate line at a different door for those who bought tickets in advance online. This line had 3 people ahead of us and we were inside in less than 5 minutes. Definitely recommend this ticket option and certainly recommend a visit here.

A place not to miss. The Abbey is incredible with its size, its history and age, its architecture and the great number of famed/historical people who have been laid to rest there. It is an "experience" that should not be missed and will trigger many connections between things learnt at school or read in books. A visit is a true history lesson for people of most ages. The length of history linked to the Abbey, back to Norman times, is just surreal.
More History. Spent 2 hours there going through all of the nooks and crannies. Big place, lot's of tourist, but easy to get around.

History coming very much alive. My 14 year old grandson and i had to queue up but the line moved very quickly definitely taking the free audio tour made our visit so worthwhile for both of us. Definitely worth waiting in line for

Impressive historical site. Fascinated by the history in this beautiful church. We used the audio guide to walk us through the church and discover all of the famous personages buried in the church. The museum was also fascinating to learn about the monarchy's lineage and coronation traditions.

Westminster - unseen. We intended to go and visit Westminster Abbey, expecting a small fee to enter. It was 20 pounds a person....just didn't see the value of going inside for that price. We're sure there were beautiful things inside but at that price we decided to pass having already seen several other chapels on this trip.We admired it from the outside and took several photos.

A must see for Any London visit.. This building is so rich with history it's hard not to be amazed by it. Simply walking into it transfers you to another time. The tours are great. The architecture is amazing. The stained glass is beautiful. I attended evensong as well as an organ concert there. Both were wonderful.

Spine-tingling.. This visit was by far my favorite. To be surrounded by so much history was awe-inspiring. I gave me chills to realize I was in some of the greatest minds in history. Do a little bit of research before and after going though...it will psyche you up and keep you in awe at all the history in this place.

Welcome to Westminster indeed. A sight you shouldn't pass up. This church is most popular and very beautiful. My daughter was with me & she was at that age where they suck their teeth & roll their eyes.

Great visit. We made it to the Abbey about an hour before the last admission on a Saturday thinking this might have a shorter line... It still took about 45 minutes but went by fairly quickly. Once inside everything was quite crowded but we were listening to the audio guide which was great and I would definitely suggest!
Must see in London. A must see on your trip to London. Allow enough time to walk around and enjoy the beauty of it all. Also, we recommend you purchase a walking tape recoreding

Wish I could go back again. I walked up the aisle like a royal bride. We prayed and lit candles. We saw the grave markers of royalty, literary giants, musical composers and scientists. Its architecture is breathtaking and the tour fascinating. I loved every second of it. HINT: You must order your tickets a day in advance.

Steeped in History . This is a fascinating place to visit it is steeped in history, take the tour and you learn many things.
You can follow the signs to the garden and take a picnic sit on the grass and just relax it's really wonderful.
A must see!. Westminister Abby is one of London's most beautiful buildings. See the great architecture of this building. Definitely a must see.

One of London's great churches. Good audio tour. Included in London Pass. Many famous and great English people are buried here. The architecture is beautiful and the history is fabulous. This is where English monarchs are crowned and the coronation chair is on display here.

Beautiful but no photography allowed. Standing in line and visiting the Abbey was worth the time and money; however, I have nothing to show for it. No photography was allowed. However, what I found irritating was that many were still taking pictures, and no one said anything. My husband and I did stay for the even' song. It was lovely. Get in line early so that you can sit among the choir as they sing. It was worth the time waiting in line. We arrived at 2, toured the Abbey, went to the café for tea, and by the time we were done, it was about 4:30. But the wait until 5 went quickly. I would do it again.
History at its best!. It is such an amazing architecture and you just can't help not capturing every single part of it. It is indeed a beautiful place history building!

Religious Wonder but Wounded by Tourism, Your's Truly Included. Westminster Abbey is magnificent and the enormity of this wonderful building is enhanced by the historical figures commemorated there. It is no wonder that the main churches of London have so many visitors and even anti-imperialists may find the collective story of Britain to be much more than East India Company and its peers plundering one nation after another. Westminster Abbey shows us those who have brought so much to mankind as well, from science to poetry, exploration of Africa to the exploration of the universe.But there's the rub. So much to see and so many people to see it, Westminster Abbey has become an efficient conveyor belt and one walks in, gets passed a guide device and off you go in a surge of others. That's great for income but I would give two pieces of advice. 1) Find out when it is quieter to go there.2) Buy online and print your tickets. You can save ages waiting.It should be 5 Stars, the notch down is because I and other tourists are legion...that's a population issue and nothing to do with the abbey itself.

Magnificent. What's to say- this is history and beauty all in one! Westminster Abbey is awe-inspiring and like no other. Don't miss the tomb of Sir Isaac Newton and the choir. The audio tour is excellent- by Jeremy Irons- and provides an excellent tour of this overwhelmingly-beautiful place!

Worth it!. More secular than sacred, Westminster Abbey is directly under the Crown rather than the Bishop of Canterbury.
There is much worth seeing here, but best to wait for a docent led tour by one of the clergy, which happen perhaps twice a day. Nice little gift shop, and just a short stroll to Parliament.

Beautiful. Amazing! It was beautiful and would go again.
So many people have been laid to rest in this one location.
It is also amazing to see where the royal wedding took place

A Tour of English History in One Building. We visited Westminster Abbey on a recent trip to London. The Abbey is one of the must-see landmarks in London. The Abbey is fairly expensive for the entrance fee, but it is so important that it is worth consideration. The Abbey is remarkable in that it is a functioning place of worship as well as a historical site. It is like a short history of England in one location. It dates back to Edward the Confessor and stretches up to historical events of today like the wedding of Prince William and Kate. Considering the amount of visitors and the many roles the building plays they handle the visitors very well. It is also a place of physical beauty. It is more than historical, it is a work of art. If one is a Christian it has even another level of significance as an important site of Christian history. It is also a functioning graveyard in a sense. Many of the monarchs of England are buried there as well as poets, musicians, and historical figures like David Livingstone. I would highly recommend a visit to the Abbey.

Breathtaking, amazing history.. Used London Pass for free entry. A must see in London. Burial place of past Kings and Queens. Saw it so much on television, nice to see it in person. Close to Big Ben, Parliament, Churchill War Museum and Westminster Pier on the Themes for cruises.

MUST SEE while in London. Every famous person in England is buried in this church. From Kings and Queens to poets and scholars. Also, England's version of the unknown soldier is here. This is where Will and Kate were married. The grounds are amazing. There is a fee to get in and also an audio tour available.
Must see for British History through the ages. Just a beautiful place with so much history. If seeing London for the first time, make sure you visit Westminster Abbey
Historic. Even bigger than I imagined. Very busy traffic around, but we were still able to get some good views and great pictures around this building.

Great to look at but we didn't venture in because the price. Westminster Abbey is located right next to Big Ben and the House of Parliament. It's a beautiful church from the outside. We did not tour inside the church because the admission fee associated with the tour. Adults are 20 pounds ($31.42 USD) and children between 6 and 16 are 9 pounds ($14.14). With so many things to see and do, we opted out of the tour inside. However, even if you aren't going to tour inside, there is plenty to take in and photograph. There is a little chapel on the grounds that you can enter free. While there is lots of history around Westminster Abbey, we opted to visit St Paul's Cathedral and go inside for free.

Beautiful architecture with loads of history & the resting place for some monarchy. Love this place with passion, the surrounding area is great to walk about and the service here is always done with great music and the lovely readings. If you walked each chapels, you could find people who you have read in the history books (ie: Bloody Mary and Queen Elizabeth I, Kind Henry 7th with his wife and many others). It a place to reflect and to pray. The gift shop is also a great place to pick a few things on the way out. highly recommended.

Wonderful place.. A truly amazing and awe inspiring place. Steeped in history with the tombs of so many famous names from history who lie here amongst the tourists and worshippers . Recent history evokes memories of Royal weddings and funerals. This is a must for anyone.

Amazing... Walk right into history.. Coronations, funerals, crypts and chapels.. Get the headphones walking tour it explains so much you would never know.. A must see in London.. There's a big line, but it moves quick..

A must-see in London.. We had toured the Abbey, seen the tombs, etc., on a prior visit to London--very interesting history and beautiful architecturally. This past month we went to the 5PM
Evensong service, very lovely and memorable and a nice place to wind down after a long day of walking and sightseeing. My comments below are based on the recent Evensong service visit.

Fabulous building ... why so expensive and why no photos?. I enjoyed walking around this really magnificent historical building, however £20 to gain entry is excessive in my opinion. I could understand if flash photography was not allowed, but disallowing photographs completely seems unreasonable. Stunning place.

Well worth your time on a visit to London. Really a fascinating tour. Actually the church is a worship center as well as a burial ground for many famous Brits! It takes a couple of hours for a self-guided tour using the headphones provided but it is well worth the time, especially if it is raining outside as it often is...smile.

Breathtaking. Just magnificent - make sure you have plenty of time to look around and expect the goose bumps as you look at the places of rest for very very past memberes of the Royal Family. Tours are wonderful and they have audio tours as well - I was lucky enough to be ther when there was an evensong - everyone welcome. the architecture and number of famous people who are buried there is beyond comprehension - you have to see it for yourself.

Amazing tour. This church is magnificent. Well worth the tour, the audio guide brings it to life. So many Kings and Queens of England are buried there in amazing tombs. Also some of the most famous writers in England are in a huge section there. They have a wonderful gift shop of some unique gifts.

What a cathedral - full of stories.. One of the must-see-places in London. Impressive building full of graves of famous people going back centuries. The place is packed with history.Take a guided tour or at least an audio guide - it's worth every penny.
Beautiful Service. I highly recommend attending the evening service. It is free to attend and hearing the organ play is amazing due to the unique acoustics.

Worship Service is a Must. Attended the 5pm boys and mens choir which was splendid. They sang very well, the service was cool to sit through and experience and it was a free way to see most of the Abbey. The service, while conservative was uplifting and neat to see how church was run in a different denomination than I was used to. Highly recommend.

Awesome. Simply amazing how long this beautiful church has stood. Kings and Queens have found their final resting place here, as well as, poets, artists, scientists and so many other familiar names. History beneath your every step.
nice tour. very interesting seeing who was buried there or who had memorials there. Also enjoyed seeing the church where William and Kate were married.

Well worth a visit. So glad I decided to visit Westminster Abbey as it was both beautiful and steeped in history. Lots to see and learn about. Would be a great place to hear an organ concert for sure.

Stunningly beautiful church loaded with history!. There is literally no way to describe the beauty and history you will see visiting Westminster Abbey. Visiting the UK was my first trip out of the United States, so I imagine there are other churches and structures in Europe and other parts of the world that would equal it...BUT it literally took our breath away. My teenage daughter loved it too. We even went back for the Evensong service which was beautiful and uplifting. It was a honor being in the church. One funny thing did happen to us...one of the people working there said, "You must be from America." We said we were and asked how he knew...he said, "You were smiling!" I guess Americans smile more! Don't miss the opportunity to see Westminster Abbey and definitely pay for the audio tour. You won't be disappointed!

Beautiful place. I loved this place and listened to the free audioguide as we toured the abbey. I wish we were allowed to take photos of this place but unfortunately we were not which was a real shame as there was so much to see
Good but expensive. It's amazing how big it is. Anyway, to visit it inside you have to pay very much... A bit too expensive to visit a church!

Very nice but very crowded. There is so much history in this place, from the grave of Sir Issac Newton, to that of many well known characters from history. As an American, I was interested to see the grave of Major John Andre, who had such a significant role in the Revolutionary War.A tip: Do a bit of homework before going to Westminster Abbey and research what memorials you want to see, as you will be overwhelmed.A second tip: If you go on a weekend, having the London Pass here really helps, as it helps you completely skip the line.

Beautiful, beautiful building. We thought we were going to do the Abbey tour, but it was so over priced we waited and went to Evensong service that evening. I am so glad we did - the choir was beautiful. We didn't get to see much of the church, but the parts we did see were beautiful and made even more meaningful by the choir service.

Definitely Worth a Visit. Being in London for 6 weeks allowed me to take my time seeing the sights that most likely wouldn't have made my list in a shorter time period. I hate to say that Westminster Abbey would not have made it, but I'm not a huge old church gal. I am so thankful for my day in the Westminster area and LOVED the Abbey. I bought my ticket online and skipped the queue out front, not that it was long on a wednesday morning. I expected a quick walk through and ended up spending over 2.5 hours in the Abbey, I even participated in communion which was a very neat experience. Communion too place at 12:30 and is free to the general public as well as those on the audio tour. The only caution I would have is if you are traveling with kids. I know I would not have had the patience to take the time Westminster deserves!

Definately Worth a vist but can be busy quite expensive.. Outstanding building - Isle not as long as it seems on TV. Architecture amazing. The famous people buried there is incredible. So much historical interest. Windows stunning. Café great the soup was very tasty and it was good to sit down. Can do audio tour or be taken round.
Nice Inside. From outsite is not so impresive but the inside is very nice. The architecture it is different from the European-spanish ones.

A must, if you are visiting london. Just the whole place is so grand, you have to visit this church. The architecture is simply stunning. There is so much history in this place. So many of the famous people are buried here in this church including many British Royals. Sir Charles Darwin is buried here as well. The church's ceiling is very beautiful and ornate and was made with local materials. Overall a very satisfying place if you are into things historical and architecture.

Spectacular grandeur! History personified! . A must do visit. The tombs, the stain glass, the history, the architecture, the calm solemn reverie all describe this place. Say a prayer even if your not religious, light a candle, make a donation. The history alone within the tombs is incredible. I would like to visit again when I have more time.
Royal announcement. What a great place to be when the announcement of the birth of Royal baby was made.Had to rush around to the Palace to see the written announcement at the gate.

Essential to visit. No visit to London is complete without a visit to the Abbey. Get there before 9:00am and join the queue (Opens at 9:30am) and have only a short wait. Recommend turning right on entering and walk all the way to the tomb of the unknown soldier (near the main doors which will be closed).... Then immagine walking the isle to the alter - go all the way! Then view the History. After exploring the Abbey, go via the cloisters to the cafe and gift shop. Both are excellent and the gift/book shop sells items not seen elsewhere in London
Interesting. It was educational. Do the walking tour you'll learn a lot. I learned a lot of unexpected things. The moment of prayer was a special moment too.
A historic gem!. No visit to London is complete without visiting the Abbey. Beautiful cathedral and SO much history in this iconic London gem. Definitely a MUST!
Tears brought to my eyes. I attended service here and felt so blessed to be in such a historic church. I couldn't keep the tears back. It is a beautiful church!

Amazing. Westminster Abbey is a magnificent National treasure and is a must for anyone visiting London. It is an amazing place to visit both from a spiritual perspective and for the fascinating historical context. There is a great deal to see with some beautiful side chapels and memorial and the Royal Coronation Chair. The Cloisters are very tranquil. It is possible to attend a service as visitors are always welcome.
So Beautiful!. Westminster Abbey is a must see. It really is beautiful. So much history with so many famous people buried here. So glad we did it.
impressive. we didnt get to go in due to limited time and huge ques but it really is a beautiful building and i would like to go back and see the inside some day

Historical Wonder. If you're in London then going to visit Westminster Abbey is a must do. It is a beautifully built building and is rich in the history of the British Monarchy. The audio guides are narrated by actor Jeremy Irons who does a marvellous job. See the tombs & memorials of famous historical figures, Mary Queen of Scots was one of many highlights. The architecture is amazing so if you're a fan of the Monarchy, Churches, History or just fine architecture then this is a must see.

Must Go. Finally we managed to visit this marvel. Best if you take a guided tour, because you will have access to some areas which you will not be able to see if you are alone. You have to pay Stg20 for entrance plus Stg5 for the guided tour. The only negative I can see is that you cannot take pictures.

Stunning, ambient, a bit expensive. Expensive (20 pounds) and no photography inside. When we went, we actually missed tickets and visiting hours - BUT we stuck around and managed to attend the evensong ceremony (it was Saturday), which is free. You sit with the choir, for about 45min-1 hour, surrounded by the stunning architecture and angelic choral sounds. You cannot walk around to see much, only what you walk past on your way to the choir stalls. However I would not trade in this experience for a tour of westminster. A unique and breath-taking experience which gave the surrounds so much more atmosphere and vice-versa. Would not advise taking advantage of the ceremony to see the inside for free - but if you like choral music this is not to be missed! (Will be going back to see everything properly at some point, of course, too impressive to not see up close!)
History. So special and filled with so much history. I could wonder for hours it my feet didn't ware out. Make sure you wear good shoes, it's worth the walking.

Go for Evensong. One of London's finest buildings with history you can feel and touch. If you want to experience it without the crowds of tourists, go to Evensong (Anglican service typically in mid-to-late afternoon. Most days, Evensong is sung by the Abbey choir which adds greatly to the experience.

Each trip we have taken that includes London, the Abbey is always visited.. Westminster Abbey's history and importance speaks for itself. This is why this magnificent landmark is always included in our London visits. Our most memorable visit was a Christmas Eve service of the 9 Lessons and Carols. We stood with many others and were finally ushered into this magnificent church and seated at the crossing. The choir began the service processing in to "Once in Royal David's City." This hymn is traditional to the start of the Lessons and Carols. Westminster Abbey is not to be missed. Be sure to give it more than a cursory visit.

Westminster Abbey Review. While it is a bit pricey to enter, it is very worth it. This is the most beautiful church with so many beloved leaders entombed. The coronation chair is quite exciting and the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier is quite sobering. I suggest buying the listening guide upon entering!

Must See. This is a must see. You have to actually go inside and look around. The history here is amazing. All the kings and queens that are buried here, royal weddings, coronations ... Must not miss this one. Unfortunately , no photos allowed.

Must see. The abbey tour was good. We did this after the Tower of London. This was perfect as the Yeomans tour made mention of many of the royals and others that had been executed at the Atower so we were able to see their tombs in the Abbey.
Allow plenty of time. We were very sad that we did not have more time to properly tour this amazing sight. You need to allow at the very least 2 hours.

England's history in one building. Westminster Abbey is not only a beautiful building but one which contains so much history and helps to tell the story of Britain. It is the burial place of many British Kings and Queens and contains memorials to countless historical figures. The entry fees are rather high but I guess it is worth it. We spend at least two hours here and the audio guides are very good in explaining the significance of everything you see.
Historical moments. Old tombstones that are very interesting to study. Also many beautiful windows. A lot of people so a bit crowded.

A "MUST"!. Went here with family and got a tour guide. The stories about the Abbey were so interesting that even our 9 year old was entertained until the very end of a 2.5 hour tour.There is so much to see and you are part of it all- nothing like your typical museum!The inside is stunning. If you had to pick one 'cultural visit' in London, Westminster Abbey, should be it!

Disappointing. The entry prices are very high and even if you arrive for opening time it is crowded, so the abbey can be a little disappointing. Its also a bit much to forbid your paying customers to take photographs- apparently on the grounds that the abbey is "sacred"- doesn't stop them taking lots of your money on entry though and routing the exits through their shop and tearoom!
